commit_message:
py3: Replaces xrange() with six.moves.range()

Since xrange has been removed in Python 3, this patch let's replace xrange()
with six.moves.range() to provide py3 compatibility.

Change-Id: I85e0748786867334756a51dcb834f84ffd1e55a7

revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2016-01-19 18:29:20.000000000', 'files': ['templates/tenantvm_floatingip.yaml', 'scripts/tripleo.sh', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Adds a simple overcloud tenant vm ping test to tripleo.sh

As discussed at [1] this adds a simple overcloud tenant vm startup,
with a floating ip attached, which is then pinged. The goal is to
eventually add tempest support though consensus seems to be we should
carry at least a ping test.

This has now been re-implemented with a heat template, which we
carry here for now (but can be moved to a better place if necessary)

The aim here is to add this to tripleo.sh to it primarily will be
consumed by toci_instack for ci

[1] https://trello.com/c/OQlIbGoK/19-toci-start-a-user-instance-and-ping-it

Change-Id: Ifbbaf0a84dd9e0530fa8b9a42a0f66793e0df94d
'}]
commit_message:
Adds a simple overcloud tenant vm ping test to tripleo.sh

As discussed at [1] this adds a simple overcloud tenant vm startup,
with a floating ip attached, which is then pinged. The goal is to
eventually add tempest support though consensus seems to be we should
carry at least a ping test.

This has now been re-implemented with a heat template, which we
carry here for now (but can be moved to a better place if necessary)

The aim here is to add this to tripleo.sh to it primarily will be
consumed by toci_instack for ci

[1] https://trello.com/c/OQlIbGoK/19-toci-start-a-user-instance-and-ping-it

Change-Id: Ifbbaf0a84dd9e0530fa8b9a42a0f66793e0df94d

When tox 2.3.0 uses the tox.ini provided by neutron,

commit_message:
bump the min tox version to 2.3.1

When tox 2.3.0 uses the tox.ini provided by neutron,
the following bug is hitten :
https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/tox/issues/181
We need to set the min version of tox to 2.3.1.

Change-Id: If2c3f4f534ff23a1f649cebea15e945563173544
Closes-bug: #1535725

commit_message:
In integration tests reference table columns by name

This should protect tests from failing due to columns reordering. To
make name referencing possible, we need to add another 'data-selenium'
attribute to every th.normal-column.

Implements blueprint: integration-tests-improvements-part1

Change-Id: Id788fc288d052c91fc84e94c91ce2a368e8a810a

commit_message:
Set selinux to permissive in Vagrant

Selinux is preventing to write on mounted volumes. Let's set it to
permissive in Vagrant box provisioning.

Change-Id: If8ea57f242166eb6f4ef618639d4ab672e5098d3
Closes-Bug: #1530766
(cherry picked from commit 6d7d48760162c5c4e75affa19c1a868f0a8d14e7)

commit_message:
Pin Docker version to 1.8.2

Currently Ansible have issues with Docker 1.8.3. We have to pin
version to 1.8.2 before including fix [1] in tagged Ansible
version.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/pull/2258

Change-Id: If802ff118782ec521acfff00e286cde703bf37b3
(cherry picked from commit 3baa57ddb701fd79bdc21964009abc0b7f7a07e6)

Using port 0 tells the OS to automatically assign a port.

commit_message:
Allow port number with 0

Using port 0 tells the OS to automatically assign a port.
We also assign port with 0 for test in Nova/Cinder unit test, so
we should allow assign port number with 0.

Change-Id: I4c70106182eff1eed4cb8810a0c84e4e060dae09
Closes-Bug: #1533497

commit_message:
Fix can't generate config sample with non-None value

There is pitfall in statement like:
  if getattr(opt.type, 'min', None)
The check returns False When opt.type.min equals 0,
We should check this with None.

Change-Id: Ie9577ab13203d296dcd8d7ec680335220261947e

commit_message:
Fix region association for endpoints.

The code matching the existing endpoints did not take the region into
account.  This was giving random results and messing up the catalog
badly.

This code fix it this and add associated rspec checks.

Closes-Bug: #1535939

Change-Id: If1cdf30c37194b3a7b08bf85860cf7fb7266f6e1

subject: Add encodeutils.to_utf8() function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 15:49:08.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/encodeutils.py', 'oslo_utils/tests/tests_encodeutils.py'], 'message': "Add encodeutils.to_utf8() function

The function replaces a very common pattern in code base supporting
Python 2 and Python 3:

    if isinstance(text, six.text_type):
        text = text.encode('utf-8')

to_utf8() accepts subtypes of bytes and six.text_type. For example,
oslo.i18n Message objects are accepted and encoded to UTF-8 as
expected.

Using encodeutils.safe_encode(text) is not reliable because it relies
on the current locale encoding which can be ASCII, whereas UTF-8 is
expected. Having to write encodeutils.safe_encode(text,
incoding='utf-8') is not obvious and error-prone (it's easy to forget
the incoming parameter).

Change-Id: I00463716b6012cbef383855999f63f99f2f52540
"}]
commit_message:
Add encodeutils.to_utf8() function

The function replaces a very common pattern in code base supporting
Python 2 and Python 3:

    if isinstance(text, six.text_type):
        text = text.encode('utf-8')

to_utf8() accepts subtypes of bytes and six.text_type. For example,
oslo.i18n Message objects are accepted and encoded to UTF-8 as
expected.

Using encodeutils.safe_encode(text) is not reliable because it relies
on the current locale encoding which can be ASCII, whereas UTF-8 is
expected. Having to write encodeutils.safe_encode(text,
incoding='utf-8') is not obvious and error-prone (it's easy to forget
the incoming parameter).

Change-Id: I00463716b6012cbef383855999f63f99f2f52540

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method CONF.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling

commit_message:
Test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method CONF.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True.
Closes-bug: #1517839

Change-Id: If01841b30c10e994028dcdefbb389425cb0facb1

commit_message:
Push deployments metadata on delete

When a deployment is deleted the metadata needs to be pushed so that
stale deployment data is not present in the metadata. There is a risk
that stale data will mask other deployments.

Change-Id: I3df4d9a27be5e59609ac4374556d3c0c707b068b
Closes-Bug: #1523705

subject: [install] Fix heat trustee configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-07 18:42:39.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/heat-install.rst'], 'message': '[install] Fix heat trustee configuration

The current example config is broken with the default deferred
authentication of trusts - the project_domain_id and project_name
cannot be specified in this section or keystone will throw a
"cannot be scoped to multiple targets" error when we attempt to get
a token scoped to a trust.

Also, the auth_uri is unused by the keystoneclient password auth
plugins, so remove it (it has been a source of confusion in the
referenced bug).

Change-Id: I6305be3c693993de4d16d82fd6de936e92c437c5
Closes-Bug: #1300246
Backport: liberty
'}]
commit_message:
[install] Fix heat trustee configuration

The current example config is broken with the default deferred
authentication of trusts - the project_domain_id and project_name
cannot be specified in this section or keystone will throw a
"cannot be scoped to multiple targets" error when we attempt to get
a token scoped to a trust.

Also, the auth_uri is unused by the keystoneclient password auth
plugins, so remove it (it has been a source of confusion in the
referenced bug).

Change-Id: I6305be3c693993de4d16d82fd6de936e92c437c5
Closes-Bug: #1300246
Backport: liberty

commit_message:
Fix test_crud_user_project_role_grants

That test, located at test_v3_assignment.py, has
become invalid, as per FIXME note attached to it.

The issue is that it was deleting the role
assignment the current user needed to to perform
the test itself.

This patch works around this by creating a second
role assignment and using it for testing.

Change-Id: I2c6a3b2e23d9ea026965350e44182bc0df80924e

commit_message:
Update eslint-plugin-angular to the latest

eslint-plugin-angular in use by the project is
quite old and the new library has changed rules.
This patch updates the library and fixes the code
where rule names have changed.

Closes-Bug: #1527417

commit_message:
Conform to <span> for icons over <i>.

We are currently using both <span> and <i> when using Icon Fonts.
<span> is more widely used so I propose that we standardize on it.

Change-Id: Ibe51e4fed9f065036227d0fe9f074ec4fa7a968e

commit_message:
Fixed qos devstack service name (should be q-qos) for -plus gate hook

This hook was introduced for experimental -plus job and is supposed to
enable advanced features like qos. Sadly, the service name was not
correct, so the service was not enabled.

The patch that introduced the hook:
I9f73b938539586022aeb22e3a32877816e1dcaba

Change-Id: I1c2e758341825d031a473d837e9a2e707e5ce5f3

commit_message:
Remove vme and ssse3 from gate64 cpu mapping

It turns out that we need to be even more restrictive on the cpu flags
we expose as some clouds don't expose vme or ssse3.

Fixes-Bug: 1535799
Change-Id: I6c8c1101771d1c5496884be7a405285472ae803a
(cherry picked from commit e62a5e1df872e332062f4d4efd6c9ef2ee4db1dd)

subject: Support for logging the nova-dhcpbridge command line
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 15:23:12.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': 'Support for logging the nova-dhcpbridge command line

We are seeing a lot of gate failures as vm(s) are unable to acquire
DHCP leases:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1532809

we need to set log_file for nova-dhcpbridge configuration, so clone
the nova.conf and set the log_file properly to a path where the
CI can pick up from for analysis.

Change-Id: Iec4fe3f2235da9d1f5bd399d4ffc45af516c58ce
(cherry picked from commit ac8ff0f1e9e5116c390bf8a711c950bcaca71d32)
(cherry picked from commit bd7a51200f3a3c11ca5f18f0b7f95ee9049e1e40)
'}]
commit_message:
Support for logging the nova-dhcpbridge command line

We are seeing a lot of gate failures as vm(s) are unable to acquire
DHCP leases:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1532809

we need to set log_file for nova-dhcpbridge configuration, so clone
the nova.conf and set the log_file properly to a path where the
CI can pick up from for analysis.

Change-Id: Iec4fe3f2235da9d1f5bd399d4ffc45af516c58ce
(cherry picked from commit ac8ff0f1e9e5116c390bf8a711c950bcaca71d32)
(cherry picked from commit bd7a51200f3a3c11ca5f18f0b7f95ee9049e1e40)

commit_message:
Bandit profile updates

We'd like to use the same "gate" profile for all OpenStack gate jobs,
so the "keystone_conservative" job which we were running as part of
the gate is change to "gate.

The other profiles that aren't used as part of the gate are removed.

Change-Id: I3dac68804bfa4930ac0dc6b4edeedd888577f3e5

to a meaningful format of assertTrue/False(***).

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 8866, 'name': 'Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho', 'email': 'rmascena@redhat.com', 'username': 'raildo'}, {'_account_id': 10046, 'name': 'Henrique Truta', 'email': 'henrique@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'henriquetruta'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-20 00:06:09.000000000', 'files': ['api/v3/identity-api-v3.rst'], 'message': 'Add filter to control listing projects acting as domains

We are about to enable projects acting as domains as the
underlying mechanism of how domains are stored. This means that
unless we do anything different, a GET /projects call (without
a domain filter) will include any projects acting as a domain.
This might cause some clients problems.

This patch proposes a new filter on GET /projects that controls
whether projects acting as a domain are included in a collection.
By default this is false, so the results will be as they are today.
As clients becomes accustomed to the concept, they can enable this
to include such projects.

This seems a more appropriate first step than just including
is_domain as a filter parameter, since otherwise we will always
force clients that understand projects as a domain to execute
two queries in order to get the full set of projects.

Partially implements: blueprint reseller

Change-Id: If1b22b46b980379136fa9470bb3e9292974c9352
'}]
commit_message:
Add filter to control listing projects acting as domains

We are about to enable projects acting as domains as the
underlying mechanism of how domains are stored. This means that
unless we do anything different, a GET /projects call (without
a domain filter) will include any projects acting as a domain.
This might cause some clients problems.

This patch proposes a new filter on GET /projects that controls
whether projects acting as a domain are included in a collection.
By default this is false, so the results will be as they are today.
As clients becomes accustomed to the concept, they can enable this
to include such projects.

This seems a more appropriate first step than just including
is_domain as a filter parameter, since otherwise we will always
force clients that understand projects as a domain to execute
two queries in order to get the full set of projects.

Partially implements: blueprint reseller

Change-Id: If1b22b46b980379136fa9470bb3e9292974c9352

subject: update validator to handle new repos being added to deliverables
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 21:57:12.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py'], 'message': 'update validator to handle new repos being added to deliverables

When a new repository is added to a deliverable in the middle of a
series, the validator gets confused trying to determine whether the new
tag is valid compared to the old one, because the old one may not exist
in the repository. Skip that step to allow new projects to be added
mid-cycle.

Change-Id: I05efc1007f906c5d341f802b14ebaae12cd52043
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
update validator to handle new repos being added to deliverables

When a new repository is added to a deliverable in the middle of a
series, the validator gets confused trying to determine whether the new
tag is valid compared to the old one, because the old one may not exist
in the repository. Skip that step to allow new projects to be added
mid-cycle.

Change-Id: I05efc1007f906c5d341f802b14ebaae12cd52043
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Emergency stevedore release for nuking argparse
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 21:26:17.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/mitaka/stevedore.yaml'], 'message': "Emergency stevedore release for nuking argparse

pip 8 has caused a lot of CI issues. uninstalling argparse
is one of them. we don't really need explicit argparse as that
is a vestige from python 2.6 days. so this was already
removed, we just need to make a release.

Change-Id: Ib61dcc891e07b084d495a21e654851441fa5294b
"}]
commit_message:
Emergency stevedore release for nuking argparse

pip 8 has caused a lot of CI issues. uninstalling argparse
is one of them. we don't really need explicit argparse as that
is a vestige from python 2.6 days. so this was already
removed, we just need to make a release.

Change-Id: Ib61dcc891e07b084d495a21e654851441fa5294b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 14:52:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/compute_node.py'], 'message': 'Add note to ComputeNode.numa_topology

As the ComputeNode is being converted away from a dict, it was
discovered that numa_topology is held in the ComputeNode as a
StringField, not an ObjectField containing a NUMATopology. Because
changing types within minor versions of an object is not a good thing to
do, a note is added to change the field over to use the NUMATopology
object in the next major version of the ComputeNode object (2.0).

Change-Id: Ife9f7aefbe64638521abcd27a9e182612fab46c7
'}]
commit_message:
Add note to ComputeNode.numa_topology

As the ComputeNode is being converted away from a dict, it was
discovered that numa_topology is held in the ComputeNode as a
StringField, not an ObjectField containing a NUMATopology. Because
changing types within minor versions of an object is not a good thing to
do, a note is added to change the field over to use the NUMATopology
object in the next major version of the ComputeNode object (2.0).

Change-Id: Ife9f7aefbe64638521abcd27a9e182612fab46c7

commit_message:
Derive asset last modified date/time from git logs

This is a feature to allow the last modified asset time to be
automatically tracked by the system to allow features such as
sorting assets by last modified time, or showing the top ten
newest assets.

Change-Id: Ie6037f575e561d61f48d5e1c21999acfd2d61dc5

subject: Remove argparse from requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 18:22:48.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d

subject: Raise NotFound exception when get a deleted stack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 09:49:20.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/orchestration/v1/stack.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/orchestration/v1/test_stack.py'], 'message': 'Raise NotFound exception when get a deleted stack

Heat will always return a stack record if query with an id, so
if a stack is deleted, we can still get it from heat, it will
break wait_for_delete function.

Change-Id: I44367fd053201dd2a20dc14dd9067e29a3a7d2a6
Closes-Bug: #1528996
'}]
commit_message:
Raise NotFound exception when get a deleted stack

Heat will always return a stack record if query with an id, so
if a stack is deleted, we can still get it from heat, it will
break wait_for_delete function.

Change-Id: I44367fd053201dd2a20dc14dd9067e29a3a7d2a6
Closes-Bug: #1528996

list/create/show/update Subnet pools extension (subnetpools).

commit_message:
Log INFO message when setting admin state up flag to False for OVS port

Disabling admin state can cause confusion in OVS agent logs as to why
VLAN 4095 is set to a particular port. This commit adds an extra INFO
log message when admin state is disabled. There is no log emitted
upon enabling admin state as there is already a detailed log entry
logged in treat_devices_added_or_updated() function.

Change-Id: I1301db8fea75af211f66a1914d1f0b706a6d5b36
Closes-Bug: 1463891
(cherry picked from commit 7ca04daa71910b578303845a363883fa036358f7)

commit_message:
Clean up removed hacking rule from [flake8] ignore lists

We bump hacking>=0.10.0, and hacking removed some rules, for
the full list of rules please see [1]. So don't need them any more.

Hacking related commits:
Remove H904 in commit b1fe19ebebe47a36b905d709467f5e82521bbd96
Remove H803 in commit f01ce4fd822546cbd52a0aedc49184bddbfe1b10
Remove H307 in commit ec4833b206c23b0b6f9c6b101c70ab925a5e9c67
Remove H305 in commit 8f1fcbdb9aa4fc61349e5e879153c722195b1233

[1]https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg#L30

Change-Id: I4524888b76e4a83710ea77603be9183839151c40

commit_message:
Refactor Windows drivers using os-win

A common library abstracting Windows specific operations has been
created in order to remove duplicated code among OpenStack projects,
also being easier to maintain.

This patch refactors Windows drivers, leveraging the os-win library.

The Windows iSCSI driver unit tests needed to be updated, for which
reason those where rewritten using mock.

Implements: blueprint windows-os-win

Change-Id: I234835eebac83baab9c3e13b6cf069734137bbc2

commit_message:
Deprecating API v2.0

Keystone team decided to deprecate v2.0 on Mitaka.

DocImpact: The keystone team recommends using v3 of our Identity API, so we
decided to formally deprecate API v2.0 on Mitaka. Authentication
routes and EC2 routes will not be deprecated for now, they will be kept
around indefinitely.

Partially implements: bp deprecated-as-of-mitaka

Co-Authored-By: Steve Martinelli <stevemar@ca.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ie3e484f08edd5acd3c89e76ba6a5c24d660a116d

subject: Add facet list support
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-01-21 00:37:04.000000000', 'files': ['searchlightclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/fakes.py', 'searchlightclient/tests/unit/v1/test_facets.py', 'searchlightclient/v1/client.py', 'searchlightclient/v1/facets.py', 'setup.cfg', 'searchlightclient/osc/v1/facet.py', 'searchlightclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_facet.py'], 'message': 'Add facet list support

This patch adds support for facet list client. New `openstack`
command:

    openstack search facet list

    optional arguments:
        --type <resource-type> Get facets for a particular resource type
        --limit-terms <limit> Restricts the number of options returned
        for fields that support facet terms
        --all-projects  Request facet terms for all projects (admin
        only)

Patial-Implement blueprint: openstack-client-search-initial-plugin

Change-Id: I5609336ac63adfa2642bd59b205ac9704468dbab
'}]
commit_message:
Add facet list support

This patch adds support for facet list client. New `openstack`
command:

    openstack search facet list

    optional arguments:
        --type <resource-type> Get facets for a particular resource type
        --limit-terms <limit> Restricts the number of options returned
        for fields that support facet terms
        --all-projects  Request facet terms for all projects (admin
        only)

Patial-Implement blueprint: openstack-client-search-initial-plugin

Change-Id: I5609336ac63adfa2642bd59b205ac9704468dbab

commit_message:
Fix permissions to /var/lib/nova/

Due to changes with the drop-root work, we lost the ability to write
to /var/lib/nova/*. This fixes those permissions and ensures cross
container talk works properly between nova_libvirt and nova_compute

Additionally, this fixes another issue introduced which saw that
nova-compute could not run sudo commands as it did not have a proper
sudoers entry

Testing from previous deploys means you need a fresh environment. You
have to remove all of the named volumes that kolla created in docker.
Check these with `docker volume ls`

Signed-off-by: Hui Kang <kangh@us.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Artur Zarzycki <azarzycki@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sam Yaple <sam@yaple.net>
Co-Authored-By: Hui Kang <kangh@us.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: #1533350
Change-Id: I7f864c448a2414e0b5d89f48337be411b891df35

commit_message:
Add pagination support to volume type

In Liberty release, we have added pagination to backups
and snapshot. There are still some work that hasn't been
done yet.
This patch add pagination support to volume type.

APIImpact
Add pagination agrs like limit, marker, sort to query
volume type.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I09226d42b1f3a2efcd6711dac9f825c9bd277b78
Implements: blueprint add-pagination-to-other-resource

commit_message:
Make Neutron attempt to advertise MTUs by default

It seems like a useful option, and it could be a more sane default,
rather than pushing the responsibility to enable this onto deployers and
provisioning tools[1]. In fact, it may be worth doing some more work to
take away some of the hassle of configuring all these things correctly,
and see if it can be automatically determined.

[1]: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/fuel-specs/specs/7.0/jumbo-frames-between-instances.html

Related-Bug: #1527675
Change-Id: I5cbbc4660f8c4e15e59f8f5ce0419501bdd27348

Provide more details in note regarding minimum version
of Open vSwitch necessary for the best experience with
scenarios that use it.

subject: Stop repeatedly logging boot time
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-20 18:34:14.000000000', 'files': ['astara/instance_manager.py', 'astara/test/unit/test_instance_manager.py'], 'message': 'Stop repeatedly logging boot time

We uncoditionally log the boot time of a resource every time update_state is
called. This causes an increasing boot time to be logged every time the
orchestrator is polled or a health check fired.  This should only be logged
once, so use a flag on the object to suppress future logging.

Change-Id: I18dc97482c9e09253bf7e692a3ed0857ac8308d6
'}]
commit_message:
Stop repeatedly logging boot time

We uncoditionally log the boot time of a resource every time update_state is
called. This causes an increasing boot time to be logged every time the
orchestrator is polled or a health check fired.  This should only be logged
once, so use a flag on the object to suppress future logging.

Change-Id: I18dc97482c9e09253bf7e692a3ed0857ac8308d6

subject: Implement pip version range
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-20 21:05:58.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Implement pip version range

This patch implements a major version range lower and
upper bound to ensure that both the repository and any
online retrieval of pip result in the same major version
being deployed.

Also, the isolated fallback should not use the extra options to
ensure that it goes to the internet to find the pip wheel
to install.

Change-Id: I93a5abdbc001348075cb43a0913407d38ae89678
'}]
commit_message:
Implement pip version range

This patch implements a major version range lower and
upper bound to ensure that both the repository and any
online retrieval of pip result in the same major version
being deployed.

Also, the isolated fallback should not use the extra options to
ensure that it goes to the internet to find the pip wheel
to install.

Change-Id: I93a5abdbc001348075cb43a0913407d38ae89678

subject: Remove argparse from requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 18:11:29.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d

subject: Consolidate osprofiler options
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-01-20 19:22:56.000000000', 'files': ['osprofiler/opts.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tests/test_opts.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Consolidate osprofiler options

Right now every project has its own copy of the profiler options,
This situation will make it very hard to keep up when we want to
change things in osprofiler. So we should consolidate the code
just like all other oslo libraries in osprofiler itself. However
one twist here is that we should avoid needing oslo.config as a
hard requirement for project that do not want to use it, so we
should add this as an extra in setup.cfg and adjust the testenv
as well.

Change-Id: I4343136be501551bb2c87d4b66d839c4e63a67fc
'}]
commit_message:
Consolidate osprofiler options

Right now every project has its own copy of the profiler options,
This situation will make it very hard to keep up when we want to
change things in osprofiler. So we should consolidate the code
just like all other oslo libraries in osprofiler itself. However
one twist here is that we should avoid needing oslo.config as a
hard requirement for project that do not want to use it, so we
should add this as an extra in setup.cfg and adjust the testenv
as well.

Change-Id: I4343136be501551bb2c87d4b66d839c4e63a67fc

commit_message:
Fix backwards compatibility for v1 API imports

All python modules in "manilaclient/v1" override v2 modules with v2 modules
and v1 modules do not provide APIs at all. So, fix those imports and add
test coverage.

Change-Id: I24835745d028fa50252207cb02304e73657696e5
Closes-Bug: #1535692

commit_message:
Adding support for configuring number of async worker processes

Adding new config parameter to control number of async worker
processes. Also removing existing parameter 'workers' as its not
used and was currently defined under DEFAULT config section.

Change-Id: I04af9d012ca86227171eecebdbf43999dd667ac5
Closes-Bug: #1519159

commit_message:
Change get_project permissions

Previously to issue GET /project a user needed
at least project_admin level of permission. With
this change, a user can issue GET /project by just
having a role on the project.

Change-Id: I92262e7ec462411e396ea033e85043918a244150
Closes-Bug: 1535878

subject: Fix missing bare Session() call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 22:25:45.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/api.py'], 'message': "Fix missing bare Session() call

This commit fixes a bare call to Session(). There was a previous
fix/workaround to the issue where the Sessionmaker factory Session()
isn't properly initialized when it was being called in an api method.
The get_session() method was added to reinitialize it if it's not
defined. However, 1 api method wasn't using this method which resulted
in a chance we'd still hit the other bug.

Change-Id: I6870ad9d0d1fe61f8783fbfb1e4e341cfb610058
"}]
commit_message:
Fix missing bare Session() call

This commit fixes a bare call to Session(). There was a previous
fix/workaround to the issue where the Sessionmaker factory Session()
isn't properly initialized when it was being called in an api method.
The get_session() method was added to reinitialize it if it's not
defined. However, 1 api method wasn't using this method which resulted
in a chance we'd still hit the other bug.

Change-Id: I6870ad9d0d1fe61f8783fbfb1e4e341cfb610058

subject: Let developers/operators add watchers to account audit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 03:06:57.000000000', 'files': ['swift/account/auditor.py', 'test/unit/account/test_auditor.py', 'setup.cfg', 'swift/common/middleware/audit_watcher.py'], 'message': 'Let developers/operators add watchers to account audit

    This is the account version of patch 212824 and works on the same
    principles.

    Cluster operators need to be able to gather information on Swift
    accounts in the cluster for utilization and auditing purposes,
    only there is no central list of all accounts in the Swift cluster.
    Right now each operator must implement a method to discover accounts
    on their own. This patch enables a way to hook into account auditors
    so they can be iterated over without additional disk IO.

    Like the object audit watcher, this patch makes the auditor locate,
    via entry points, the watchers named in its config file.

    A watcher is a class with at least these four methods:

       __init__(self, conf, logger)
       start(self, audit_type)
       see_target(self, *data)
       end(self)

    The auditor will call watcher.start(audit_type) at the start of an
    audit pass, watcher.see_target(*data) for each account audited, and
    watcher.end() at the end of an audit pass.

    The user-supplied watcher code runs entirely in a child process of the
    auditor process (of which there may be many, if parallel audits are in
    use). This lets the auditor continue working even if the watcher
    crashes or hangs. These subprocesses are automatically killed (after a
    short delay) upon completion of an audit pass.

    Change-Id: Ibd15217bd65bcf74409422f08d561ee4501bc19d

Change-Id: If5a09ac38eae726d616119ee27eed75450be437d
'}]
commit_message:
Let developers/operators add watchers to account audit

    This is the account version of patch 212824 and works on the same
    principles.

    Cluster operators need to be able to gather information on Swift
    accounts in the cluster for utilization and auditing purposes,
    only there is no central list of all accounts in the Swift cluster.
    Right now each operator must implement a method to discover accounts
    on their own. This patch enables a way to hook into account auditors
    so they can be iterated over without additional disk IO.

    Like the object audit watcher, this patch makes the auditor locate,
    via entry points, the watchers named in its config file.

    A watcher is a class with at least these four methods:

       __init__(self, conf, logger)
       start(self, audit_type)
       see_target(self, *data)
       end(self)

    The auditor will call watcher.start(audit_type) at the start of an
    audit pass, watcher.see_target(*data) for each account audited, and
    watcher.end() at the end of an audit pass.

    The user-supplied watcher code runs entirely in a child process of the
    auditor process (of which there may be many, if parallel audits are in
    use). This lets the auditor continue working even if the watcher
    crashes or hangs. These subprocesses are automatically killed (after a
    short delay) upon completion of an audit pass.

    Change-Id: Ibd15217bd65bcf74409422f08d561ee4501bc19d

Change-Id: If5a09ac38eae726d616119ee27eed75450be437d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 23:24:04.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxscsi.py', 'os_brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py'], 'message': 'Fix get_device_size with newlines

Change-Id: I5917c0ad1a94b9d8ca6a41b278f9156193198a1d
Closes-Bug: #1535913
'}]
commit_message:
Fix get_device_size with newlines

This patch adds strip() call to the return value
of the blockdevice call to fetch the size.  Sometimes we get a newline
after the size value.

Change-Id: I5917c0ad1a94b9d8ca6a41b278f9156193198a1d

subject: Only decode output of subprocess

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-20 21:31:23.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_bandit_baseline.py', 'bandit/cli/baseline.py'], 'message': 'Only decode output of subprocess

Fixes the Bandit baseline attempt to decode the output of a subprocess call
(into UTF-8) and the output of a possible CalledProcessError. As the output
format of the CalledProcessError does not have the "decode" attribute,
resulting in an AttributeError.

Change-Id: I9c23a567abab0a7fdeafa273d1e461d267b03fac
Closes-Bug: #1536359
'}]
commit_message:
Only decode output of subprocess

Fixes the Bandit baseline attempt to decode the output of a subprocess call
(into UTF-8) and the output of a possible CalledProcessError. As the output
format of the CalledProcessError does not have the "decode" attribute,
resulting in an AttributeError.

Change-Id: I9c23a567abab0a7fdeafa273d1e461d267b03fac
Closes-Bug: #1536359

Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11997, 'name': 'Lennart Regebro', 'email': 'lregebro@redhat.com', 'username': 'lregebro'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-18 17:47:05.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud.conf.sample', 'instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'instack_undercloud/tests/test_undercloud.py'], 'message': 'Allow setting the hostname during undercloud install

Getting the hostname settings right is a particularly annoying and
tricky part of the undercloud install.  Allow users to specify a
fixed hostname in undercloud.conf, which we will then use to
automatically configure the hostname settings on the system.

Also improves the /etc/hosts check so it just adds the necessary
entries to /etc/hosts rather than raising an error when they are
missing.

Change-Id: Ice707153636c702be90c55adbbc5f081dcb0ee74
'}]
commit_message:
Allow setting the hostname during undercloud install

Getting the hostname settings right is a particularly annoying and
tricky part of the undercloud install.  Allow users to specify a
fixed hostname in undercloud.conf, which we will then use to
automatically configure the hostname settings on the system.

Also improves the /etc/hosts check so it just adds the necessary
entries to /etc/hosts rather than raising an error when they are
missing.

Change-Id: Ice707153636c702be90c55adbbc5f081dcb0ee74

This change adjusts the size of the buffer for decrypted data to prevent the
"0x150L CKR_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL" error from the HSM when attempting to decrypt

Change-Id: I8c4021b5c143f734ea2eb0cea13e7a58fe8f9852
Closes-Bug: 1535935
'}]
commit_message:
Fix buffer size for decrypt operations.

This change adjusts the size of the buffer for decrypted data to prevent the
"0x150L CKR_BUFFER_TOO_SMALL" error from the HSM when attempting to decrypt
2048 bit certificate payloads.

Change-Id: I8c4021b5c143f734ea2eb0cea13e7a58fe8f9852
Closes-Bug: 1535935

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 8090, 'name': 'Chad Roberts', 'email': 'croberts@redhat.com', 'username': 'croberts'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 12673, 'name': 'Duk Loi', 'email': 'duk@tesora.com', 'username': 'duktesora'}, {'_account_id': 14823, 'name': 'Pete MacKinnon', 'email': 'pmackinn@redhat.com', 'username': 'pmackinn'}, {'_account_id': 14829, 'name': 'Ashleigh Farnham', 'username': 'ashleighfarnham', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 15321, 'name': 'Matthew Van Dijk', 'email': 'mvandijk@tesora.com', 'username': 'mvandijk'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-05 14:16:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/_add_shard.html', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/cluster_grow_details.html', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/add_shard.html', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/urls.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/_add_instance.html', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/api/trove.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/trove_data.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/cluster_manager.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/cluster_shrink_details.html', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/databases/db_capability.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/add_instance.html', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/forms.py'], 'message': 'Trove add cluster grow and shrink support

Add support for Trove commands cluster-grow and cluster-shrink.

Added the grow and shrink actions to the clusters list table.  The
grow and shrink actions are only available for MongoDB and Redis
clusters.

Added the grow panel table to list the new instances to be added to
the cluster.  There is a table action Add Instance where the instance
details are specified then added to the new instances table.
A Remove Instance table and row action is available to remove any
instances from the table.  A Grow Cluster table action will add the
instances to the instances in the table to the cluster.  Removed the
add shard action as it is now deprecated and is replaced by the
grow action.

Added a cluster manager helper to keep track of the newly added
instances in the grow panel.

Added the shrink panel table that lists the instances belonging to
the cluster in a table.  The selected instance(s) can then be
removed from the cluster with the shrink command.

Added the cluster_grow and cluster_shrink commands to the api.

Change-Id: I391c731ad63de8d2a326d181cb7d7f5a680c6508
Implements: blueprint trove-support-cluster-grow-shrink
'}]
commit_message:
Trove add cluster grow and shrink support

Add support for Trove commands cluster-grow and cluster-shrink.

Added the grow and shrink actions to the clusters list table.  The
grow and shrink actions are only available for MongoDB and Redis
clusters.

Added the grow panel table to list the new instances to be added to
the cluster.  There is a table action Add Instance where the instance
details are specified then added to the new instances table.
A Remove Instance table and row action is available to remove any
instances from the table.  A Grow Cluster table action will add the
instances to the instances in the table to the cluster.  Removed the
add shard action as it is now deprecated and is replaced by the
grow action.

Added a cluster manager helper to keep track of the newly added
instances in the grow panel.

Added the shrink panel table that lists the instances belonging to
the cluster in a table.  The selected instance(s) can then be
removed from the cluster with the shrink command.

Added the cluster_grow and cluster_shrink commands to the api.

Change-Id: I391c731ad63de8d2a326d181cb7d7f5a680c6508
Implements: blueprint trove-support-cluster-grow-shrink

commit_message:
Change URL for keystone backend check

Set httpchk option to check /v3 URL in order
to avoid getting false-positives from apache2
in case when apache is listening but keystone
is not yet configured.

Change-Id: If78e7664c0184ff1064d80bd523c44156c005d69
Closes-bug: #1533588
(cherry picked from commit 6bce1626a869e792e3077bcfc4a32bcc5dcb1453)

commit_message:
Security update for monasca-log-api

Created middleware to authorize access
to log api. Only configured roles (i.e. default) can access
the api. Also middleware detect if the request would
come from monasca-log-agent.

Summary:
- middleware added (logic + tests)
- extended documentation

Additionaly:
- added better tox processing
- added minimum coverage

Change-Id: Ic848bfa3a8552887661f8223078efe3a4bca5c37

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching

Change-Id: Ic7221f32ec7edf5372ecaabd46e00d2bd4f472f6
Closes-Bug: #1368661

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run.

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: Ic7221f32ec7edf5372ecaabd46e00d2bd4f472f6
Closes-Bug: #1368661

subject: Remove argparse from requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 18:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d

commit_message:
Add flow durations to DurationListener

This modifies the private interface a little so if
people have custom subclasses, it will require them
to modify their _record_ending function to take additional
arguments.  Afaik, we're the only ones insane enough to
do such a thing and we're ok with the change.

Change-Id: I24444d65a566023afcd1546e4f784ecae36d6126
Fixes: #1510248

commit_message:
Emergency oslo.config release for nuking argparse

pip 8 has caused a lot of CI issues. uninstalling argparse
is one of them. we don't really need explicit argparse as that
is a vestige from python 2.6 days.

Change-Id: Ib20ff8ecb3ef263b3395fa536d42c9687c2214c9

commit_message:
Add debug testenv in tox

Once we add debug testenv, we can use "tox -e debug" to debug test cases
when tox is running. Then tox will use oslotest which really debug our
test cases. Only we should do is insert pdb into code.
It's easy to use.

the same in magnum:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/266020/

Closes-Bug: #1534030
Change-Id: I63ea8086e269b4ecacb7f7e337f1adf2a869db94

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-16 14:41:57.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/post_puppet_compute.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/post_puppet_cinder_storage.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/swift-storage-post.yaml', 'puppet/ceph-storage-post.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/yum_update_post.sh', 'docker/compute-post.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/post_puppet_ceph_storage.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/post_puppet_swift_storage.yaml', 'overcloud.yaml', 'puppet/compute-post.yaml', 'puppet/cinder-storage-post.yaml'], 'message': "yum update after puppet on non-controller roles

When we update non-controller roles, we run yum update with --exclude
specified for puppet managed packages. Puppet then updates these
packages when it runs later during the stack-update.

However, this scenario can result in not all packages being updated. For
example, a dependency could end up being excluded during the
UpdateDeployment, but Puppet doesn't know to update the dependency
either.

This patch makes sure everything will get updated by doing another
iteration of yum update (with no --exclude specified) after puppet has
run.

Closes-Bug: #1522943
Change-Id: I2565e69d0237116f32c1d8715aa86b0de4856a40
"}]
commit_message:
yum update after puppet on non-controller roles

When we update non-controller roles, we run yum update with --exclude
specified for puppet managed packages. Puppet then updates these
packages when it runs later during the stack-update.

However, this scenario can result in not all packages being updated. For
example, a dependency could end up being excluded during the
UpdateDeployment, but Puppet doesn't know to update the dependency
either.

This patch makes sure everything will get updated by doing another
iteration of yum update (with no --exclude specified) after puppet has
run.

Closes-Bug: #1522943
Change-Id: I2565e69d0237116f32c1d8715aa86b0de4856a40

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-12-21 21:32:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_dvrscheduler_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'DVR:Fix _notify_l3_agent_new_port for proper arp update

Now with notifications coming from ml2 plugin on port create
and port update, it is worth fixing the existing _notify_
l3_agent_new_port for proper arp update and router scheduling.

Previously we have been sending arp update and calling router
scheduling for every update notification for service ports,
but now we can take necessary action only when required, since
the fix to update the arp and router scheduling was recently
done by sending the port info for every new port created.

When _notify_l3_agent_port_update is triggered, we check if the
original port host binding exists and if there is a change in
host binding with respect to the new port, then we go ahead and
reschedule the router on the new host and flush the arp entry.

Related-Bug: #1524020

Change-Id: Ifda623d5413b72bf80f38fba5c12a05a88bb7de5
'}]
commit_message:
DVR:Fix _notify_l3_agent_new_port for proper arp update

Now with notifications coming from ml2 plugin on port create
and port update, it is worth fixing the existing _notify_
l3_agent_new_port for proper arp update and router scheduling.

Previously we have been sending arp update and calling router
scheduling for every update notification for service ports,
but now we can take necessary action only when required, since
the fix to update the arp and router scheduling was recently
done by sending the port info for every new port created.

When _notify_l3_agent_port_update is triggered, we check if the
original port host binding exists and if there is a change in
host binding with respect to the new port, then we go ahead and
reschedule the router on the new host and flush the arp entry.

Related-Bug: #1524020

Change-Id: Ifda623d5413b72bf80f38fba5c12a05a88bb7de5

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 04:30:31.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/openstack/common/apiclient/auth.py', 'magnumclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py', 'magnumclient/openstack/common/apiclient/exceptions.py', 'magnumclient/openstack/common/cliutils.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems(dict) with dict.items()

Replacing dict.iteritems()/.itervalues() with
six.iteritems(dict)/six.itervalues(dict) was preferred in the past
but there was a discussion suggesting to avoid six for this.
ref:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I60cf0f7f23d26528835966f57bc5624c4b446376
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems(dict) with dict.items()

Replacing dict.iteritems()/.itervalues() with
six.iteritems(dict)/six.itervalues(dict) was preferred in the past
but there was a discussion suggesting to avoid six for this.
ref:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I60cf0f7f23d26528835966f57bc5624c4b446376

subject: Clarify that size in root device hints and local_gb are often different
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-20 16:02:49.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deploy/install-guide.rst'], 'message': 'Clarify that size in root device hints and local_gb are often different

We often set local_gb = size - 1, while in root device hints size
is expected to be real.

Change-Id: Ia1d53fa66870b13bff53324c85cef9731d59f71b
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify that size in root device hints and local_gb are often different

We often set local_gb = size - 1, while in root device hints size
is expected to be real.

Change-Id: Ia1d53fa66870b13bff53324c85cef9731d59f71b

commit_message:
Remove a done todo list item

The TODO comment on "make this configurable" is confusing because it is,
in fact, configurable. Remove the comment. Also, while doing that, put
the default value somewhere sane, and change the variable name to match
the config source better.

Change-Id: I52c456f29395bfa84d9504e2a59d8390ffbd451a

commit_message:
support hlinux crash dump detection

Tested on the hlm cluster and saw that an existing crash dump
did not have a datetime as the directory name.  This now
supports crash directories with any name.

Change-Id: Iabd1815a444058183a47f9c5104cd7c732bb2466

subject: Reorganize the developer's main page
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 22:25:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst'], 'message': "Reorganize the developer's main page

This reorganizes the developer's main page by adding a
'Commands and API References' section at the same level
as the sections for Administrator's & Developer's guides.

It also removes subsections like 'Introduction' and 'Overview'
that didn't make sense any more since they included more than
one might expect from such sections.

Change-Id: Ibf5415d946238ffadedc36c9a731f773f4fa2d71
"}]
commit_message:
Reorganize the developer's main page

This reorganizes the developer's main page by adding a
'Commands and API References' section at the same level
as the sections for Administrator's & Developer's guides.

It also removes subsections like 'Introduction' and 'Overview'
that didn't make sense any more since they included more than
one might expect from such sections.

Change-Id: Ibf5415d946238ffadedc36c9a731f773f4fa2d71

commit_message:
Ensure disk unattached if attach error occurs

If call to Cinder fails during an attach, ensure
that the disk is no longer attached to the instance
before raising the exception.

Change-Id: I912444903d267cd5aef6d3f7521e974eae540dc1
Closes-Bug: #1484125

subject: Fix network connectivity issues
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 12:40:36.000000000', 'files': ['virtualbox/functions/product.sh'], 'message': "Fix network connectivity issues

Master node needs an outbound internet connection to download repository
metadata during admin node bootstrap process. We need to wait until it
starts building docker containers, then enable the connection and wait
until the bootstrap process completes.

This change depends on another patch, which makes 'dockerctl build all'
much more verbose (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/261062/36).

Change-Id: Ibcc50bb47bd95dc1675aaf1abddbac375a434e2a
Depends-On: I77a1d3a32633390c1fe37bbeb81da5d0996972df
Closes-Bug: 1525967
(cherry picked from commit cf5e98161297072677211e890a8d7eaafae45087)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix network connectivity issues

Master node needs an outbound internet connection to download repository
metadata during admin node bootstrap process. We need to wait until it
starts building docker containers, then enable the connection and wait
until the bootstrap process completes.

This change depends on another patch, which makes 'dockerctl build all'
much more verbose (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/261062/36).

Change-Id: Ibcc50bb47bd95dc1675aaf1abddbac375a434e2a
Depends-On: I77a1d3a32633390c1fe37bbeb81da5d0996972df
Closes-Bug: 1525967
(cherry picked from commit cf5e98161297072677211e890a8d7eaafae45087)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-19 10:39:26.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/common/auth.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py'], 'message': "Remove unnecessary auth module

This commit removes common/auth.py file and changes
the way how endpoint for MultiTenant store is found.

Without having custom implementation it's better to
use an unified method 'url_for' that service_catalog
provides.

Co-Authored-By: kairat_kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: If8d07e378140a940317db1259a58477d7809948e

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary auth module

This commit removes common/auth.py file and changes
the way how endpoint for MultiTenant store is found.

Without having custom implementation it's better to
use an unified method 'url_for' that service_catalog
provides.

Co-Authored-By: kairat_kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: If8d07e378140a940317db1259a58477d7809948e

in sahara/service/edp/oozie/workflow_creator/workflow_factory.py.
function get_possible_job_config().This function is for all plugin,
we should not use the specific vanilla v2.6.0 config file. Actually
every plugin has his own config file for Hive and PIG, and they deal
with it in plugin's own get_possible_job_config() method, so we should

Change-Id: Ieaee3bcc7a21344face14a6f13d4c30fdc631038
Closes-bug: 1526391

commit_message:
Add a common Hive and Pig config in workflow_factory

in sahara/service/edp/oozie/workflow_creator/workflow_factory.py.
function get_possible_job_config().This function is for all plugin,
we should not use the specific vanilla v2.6.0 config file. Actually
every plugin has his own config file for Hive and PIG, and they deal
with it in plugin's own get_possible_job_config() method, so we should
make a common Hive and Pig config file here.

Change-Id: Ieaee3bcc7a21344face14a6f13d4c30fdc631038
Closes-bug: 1526391

subject: Explicitely configure the heat_admin user domain name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-18 23:02:45.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/keystone/domain.pp', 'spec/classes/heat_keystone_domain_spec.rb'], 'message': "Explicitely configure the heat_admin user domain name

It doesn't look like the keystone_user provider does any magic
to recover the domain name from the format <user>::<domain> but
expects a domain to be provided as a parameter.

Change-Id: I8ad125824f0de8b5c9467d08a9e33e3cb73792b4
Closes-Bug: 1535384
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitely configure the heat_admin user domain name

It doesn't look like the keystone_user provider does any magic
to recover the domain name from the format <user>::<domain> but
expects a domain to be provided as a parameter.

Change-Id: I8ad125824f0de8b5c9467d08a9e33e3cb73792b4
Closes-Bug: 1535384

add alarm interface

this adds functionality to support ceilometer+aodh. it supports:
- aodh alarm list
- aodh alarm show
- aodh alarm search
- aodh alarm create
- aodh alarm update
- aodh alarm delete

commit_message:
Implied roles driver and manager

CRD for the rules that allow one role to infer another role.
When listing roles, implied roles are inferred from any explicitly
assigned roles.  A config option controls whether implied roles
are expanded in the auth data associated with tokens.

The list_assignment tests helper is also modified to
allow data driven tests for implied roles, and those new tests
are also included here.

Implied roles are not supported by the LDAP drivers; if you
try and CRD implied roles with an LDAP assignment driver a
NotImplemented is returned.

Co-Authored-By: Henry Nash <henryn@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Partially implements: blueprint implied-roles
Change-Id: I6a9c23aea4b1f348c6c8c2b9274865806d856b82

commit_message:
Allow monitor plugins to set own metric object

The values reported by a monitor depends on type of value which
will not be uniform for all the monitors. For example, the memory
bandwidth monitor will return a dict of ints while the cpu monitor
returns a normal int value. The monitor metric objects offer
different fields to be set depending on the monitor in question.

This patchset allows the monitors to decide what metric field
it would like to populate as over a general implementation of
creating the monitor metric object inside the base module.

Related to blueprint memory-bw

Change-Id: Id5637f16ee3073a8b268c778b9f91f9f0ca309b2
Co-Authored-By: Ahilan Rajadeva <rajadeva@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add microversion to allow uuid in server show response data

This commit add uuid into server show <server-id> response
data with microversions.

This commit also create an uuid when a new security-groups
is created. For the security-groups created before, the uuid
field stays to be None.

APIImpact
Related to blueprint add-id-to-security-groups-for-server-show

Change-Id: I38adc7d42edebbf2c3c50671b2371114de5f6019

commit_message:
Implements Blueprint: Add Cinder Volume Type in BlockDeviceConfig when booting

We always create the instance by using block-device option for san storage.
So We need the volume type setting function on creating because of a variety
of qos. (In vda).

The usage is as follows.

nova boot <display_name> --flavor <flavor_id> --block-device id=<image_id>,
source=image,dest=volume,device=vda,size=10,bootindex=0,shutdown=remove,
volume_type=high_iops

1. get volume_type when creating instance
2. store information in bdm
3. passed as an volume_type argument, when creating a cinder volume.

Change-Id: I43b22b9b5e06a14a63a7f6a32eb1bb1ac80d6249
Implements: blueprint add-volume-type-in-blockdeviceconfig

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-29 11:25:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_services.py'], 'message': 'Refactor os-services unit tests

- Replace duplicate tests in v21 test class with appropriate ones in v2
   Unit tests for detailed and non-detailed service listing/filtering
  in version 2.1 are identical, as when the endpoint got lifted to the
  new API version, features that were optional became fixed and these
  attributes are always returned. To keep the coverage in the old
  version two cases are added for the two toggle-able attributes.
  Filtering and detailed listing still covered with the inherited test
  cases.
- Rearrange parameters in asserts, so unit test failure printouts
  correctly show reference and test results

Change-Id: I82a100cddf1a745bde457b17102682bd42e4608b
Related-Bug: #1217026
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor os-services unit tests

- Replace duplicate tests in v21 test class with appropriate ones in v2
   Unit tests for detailed and non-detailed service listing/filtering
  in version 2.1 are identical, as when the endpoint got lifted to the
  new API version, features that were optional became fixed and these
  attributes are always returned. To keep the coverage in the old
  version two cases are added for the two toggle-able attributes.
  Filtering and detailed listing still covered with the inherited test
  cases.
- Rearrange parameters in asserts, so unit test failure printouts
  correctly show reference and test results

Change-Id: I82a100cddf1a745bde457b17102682bd42e4608b
Related-Bug: #1217026

commit_message:
Adding IPv6 static routes and static routes template

When using IPv6 and interface configuration injection
we need to include IPv6 routes. This commit also
includes a working interfaces template for static
routes, which includes IPv4 and IPv6.

To use the provided template, set
'injected_network_template' to
'nova/virt/interfaces-static-routes.template' in
nova.conf.

Implements blueprint interfaces-template-routes
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia5014884de82253156ebdaf4dbf9990cc358a5d2

commit_message:
Add support for provider networks in network_data.json

A provider network is a virtual network administratively created to
map to a specific physical network in the data center, typically to
enable direct access to non-OpenStack resources on that network.
Tenants can be given access to provider networks. These are typically
VLANs and GRE tunnels. These provider networks are particularly
useful for bare metal instances.

network_data.json will represent this information so these networks can
be configured automatically by cloud-init and other similar systems.
Cloud-init will be written so that the networkss are only configured
as necessary, probably by looking at the NIC 'type' field to determine
if the NIC is a physical NIC. Virtual instances using OVS and similar
virtual switches will likely not need the segmentation tagging to be added.

Partial-Implements: blueprint metadata-service-network-info
Change-Id: Iee14a29eb1a77597848e86d6e59c078a0899d9c7

commit_message:
Map physical ports to networks.

- Support hints on mappings between physical network ports and networks.
- Ensure Ironic physical interfaces are tagged with the appropriate virtual interface UUIDs.

Change-Id: I3507e8b44d267791eb548b70153af5ade3f48d5a
Closes-Bug: 1405131

commit_message:
libvirt: Add post_connection_terminated

When multiple iSCSI connections are terminated
it is very likely to happen that not all
iSCSI devices and multipath devices are deleted
on the host (where nova-compute is running).
This bugfix adds the possibility to call
post_connection_terminated to the libvirt driver
which can be called after terminate_connection
is called. In the case of iSCSI it will a second
time remove the iSCSI and multipath devices.

Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kholkin <pkholkin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Nikitin <snikitin@mirantis.com>

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1336683

Change-Id: I817214749fdb0da8d577ebd89ebdde4f670006ed

commit_message:
libvirt: Allow CoW cloning of ISO images on RBD.

Avoid unnecessary downloading of ISO image from Glance when Glance
also uses Ceph/RBD.

Change-Id: I8fb5131839563bba61f7e65091a9e71088ed8e37

commit_message:
Move more qemu calls into virt.images

I'd like to move calls to qemu into a central place because it will
make it easier to work around the vagaries of qemu in a consistent
manner.

commit_message:
Add uuid into SecurityGroup object

Currently, there is no restriction for this field, and it could
be nullable. We could add additional restriction for it in the
furture.

Also, this commit updates some obj_relationships mapping and
fingerprint.

Related to blueprint add-id-to-security-groups-for-server-show

Change-Id: I841871a63db798541547961626af9cdea963e4de

commit_message:
WIP: Replace service groups with the tooz groups

These changes adds a new tooz driver to manage service
group. Tooz(a new oslo library) will provide same
functionality as the exsisting service group drivers
in place using through tooz's own group membership
abstraction. Firstly introduce the tooz driver and use
it the same way as other drivers are being used. Next
step would be to propose the replacement startegy as we
want to support exsisting drivers alongwith the migration to
tooz.

Change-Id: Id7fe9370756b58a375b4d0286c22502a77ec80ab
Implements: blueprint tooz-for-service-groups

commit_message:
DNM Cells: Provide example request flows for v2

This updates the devref with a high level walkthrough of how some
requests will work in the world of cells v2.  It will be a useful
reference to point to for explaining how specs fit into the larger
picture.  It is also a reference to specs that are in progress and
points out areas that don't yet have specs.

It is not intended to merge, just be a place of discussion and
bookkeeping.

Change-Id: I25a222a231d5932a187d45eafce78c28c6134618

commit_message:
Cells: - weight_offset; + selection_multiplier

Weight offsets have been broken since normalization was added. A
selection multiplier allows the operator to directly increase or
decrease the probability of cell selection during scheduling
(including completely disabling a cell by setting multiplier to 0).

UpgradeImpact: WeightOffsetWeigher is deprecated

Change-Id: I25129363c7d3fc7c94001b1fd5f5ba7cca90ea8b

commit_message:
Object: Merge db accesses for extra field of instance

This patch puts all extra fields to a local variable extra_db_updates
and add a new provite function to handler db access of update operation.

By doing this it will reduce db access when do instances.save() if there
is any extra fields in instance object.

Change-Id: I3b5dcac6dfe1aa9f367c31a9e7ee206e69fea2cf

commit_message:
switch releasenotes job to branch-git-prep

Use branch-git-prep instead of zuul-git-branch-prep to prepare the local
source repository, since it appears the latter does not work properly in
post jobs, yet.

Change-Id: I8cbcd49ff4bf7234e149985535f394bb686c58c3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Remove argparse from requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 18:03:20.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it
from requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is really not needed.

Change-Id: Id8984ef560f0bb3006e360a8cb32fc015a9ccfcf
'}]
commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it
from requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is really not needed.

Change-Id: Id8984ef560f0bb3006e360a8cb32fc015a9ccfcf

revisions:
[{'number': 36, 'created': '2016-01-19 18:29:02.000000000', 'files': ['networking_sfc/services/sfc/agent/br_int.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/agent/br_tun.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/agent/__init__.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/agent/br_phys.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/agent/agent.py', 'networking_sfc/tests/unit/services/sfc/agent/test-agent.py', 'networking_sfc/tests/unit/services/sfc/agent/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Realizing SFC: OVS Agent and OVS

This patch implements OVS agent and OVS related changes as well as
unit tests for realizing Service Function Chaining (SFC) as PoC.
 - update the latest code of ovs sfc agent
 - fix issues after neutron code updates
 - fix issues listed in comments
 - support across different subnet without assigning vRouter
 - optimize and issue fix:
   assigning the output port instead of impement normal action
 - fix issue: incorrect segmentation_id is used next hop sf

Co-Authored-By: Cathy Zhang <cathy.h.zhang@huawei.com>

Change-Id: Ib0f530cdeef4d91d67e0a87c92c46ac6e75834b2

commit_message:
Realizing SFC: OVS Agent and OVS

This patch implements OVS agent and OVS related changes as well as
unit tests for realizing Service Function Chaining (SFC) as PoC.
 - update the latest code of ovs sfc agent
 - fix issues after neutron code updates
 - fix issues listed in comments
 - support across different subnet without assigning vRouter
 - optimize and issue fix:
   assigning the output port instead of impement normal action
 - fix issue: incorrect segmentation_id is used next hop sf

Co-Authored-By: Cathy Zhang <cathy.h.zhang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Louis Fourie <louis.fourie@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Fei Rao  <milo.frao@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ib0f530cdeef4d91d67e0a87c92c46ac6e75834b2

commit_message:
Implementing SFC OVS Driver

This patch implements OVS driver implementation for realizing
Service Function Chaining (SFC) as PoC.

Outstanding Items:
 - OVS-Agent changes.
 - Add Unit tests.
 - Check the applicability of API/Functional/FullStack tests.
 - Rebase the change
 - update the latest ovs driver change
 - cleanup co-authors
 - fix issues listed in comments
 - fix port pair group update and port chain update issues
 - Optimize the port qeury
 - Fix issue: If the next hop is on the other compute node,
   and there is no same network vm on the local compute node,
   sfc-agent need to allocated a local vlan id for this network,
   and install related tunnel flow rules.
 - Fix issue: Port chain update fail when multiple flow classifieries
   have the same logical source port
 - Support DVR
 - install a fdb entry if there is no entry of next hop sf in local
   host. eg, host1(network1 vms)->host2(network2 vms). If dvr is
   enabled, then this patch is not necessary.

Co-Authored-By: Cathy Zhang <cathy.h.zhang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Louis Fourie <louis.fourie@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Fei Rao <milo.frao@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I42a8b9f7cda27cf3635c3ffdd368a41d603e3c51

commit_message:
Update connection string generation

This change leverages the os_database_connection function from
openstacklib to generate the connection strings for our services. As
part of this change, we are moving the database connection string
generation to the osnailyfacter modular tasks and updating the
openstack classes to consume a connection string rather than the
seperate host, user, password, database name and database type.

Additionally as part of this change, we are updating the mysql
connection strings to only include read_time=60 if debian based packages
are used. This is due to the fact that python-pymysql, which is used by
Ubuntu packages, does not support the read_timeout option as part of the
connection string.

Change-Id: I45c51a05ba7cf9648b0202cc3c2216d185bd7eda
Closes-Bug: #1526938
Related-Blueprint: deploy-with-uca-packages

commit_message:
moved toctree to correct place

- before, the sections appeared in wrong order:
  * Launch an instance from a volume
  * Launch an instance using ISO image
  * (without headline: the introduction to instances,
    "Instances are virtual machines that run inside the cloud. [...]")
  * Gather parameters to launch an instance
  * Launch an instance from an image
    (which was not apparent from the HTML output,
     but becomes obvious in PDF output)

- now the order is:
  * introduction to instances (without headline)
  * Gather parameters to launch an instance
  * Launch an instance from an image
  * Launch an instance from a volume
  * Launch an instance using ISO image

Change-Id: I21f813070bb48d804da437c930825a633758e467

commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it
from requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is really not needed.

Change-Id: I7a71182955eb37c7cc5f6f813be85e188c34a9f3

subject: increase large-ops job timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 16:24:08.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "increase large-ops job timeout

The large-ops overall jenkins job timeout is 60 minutes. However,
since the move to upper-constraints, and the lack of cached wheels,
we're spending 13 minutes installing python packages. This is very
often tripping use past the 60 minute timeout very barely. Bump this
up for more headroom so that we only fail if tempest actually fails,
not because pip is slow.

Change-Id: I49365b972e7095e3a65d9483181814c42de5df8b
"}]
commit_message:
increase large-ops job timeout

The large-ops overall jenkins job timeout is 60 minutes. However,
since the move to upper-constraints, and the lack of cached wheels,
we're spending 13 minutes installing python packages. This is very
often tripping use past the 60 minute timeout very barely. Bump this
up for more headroom so that we only fail if tempest actually fails,
not because pip is slow.

Change-Id: I49365b972e7095e3a65d9483181814c42de5df8b

commit_message:
Remove redundant checks

By default if a value is empty or an attibute is not present, None
will be returned. Adding is specifically is not needed. Cleanup
parts of code which does this check.

Change-Id: I3f355db5788a1fc0fe7b8e3332d926306bf35e03

subject: Delete python bytecode before every test run
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-11 15:26:17.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc|pyo files and __pycache__
directories during tox runs, certain changes in the tree,
like deletes of files, or switching branches, can create
spurious errors.

The target bytecodes for deletion are in normal directories,
but not in dot started directory.

Change-Id: If79295af6c15da04017787daccfb67a9817ac27c
Fixes: bug #1532525
'}]
commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc|pyo files and __pycache__
directories during tox runs, certain changes in the tree,
like deletes of files, or switching branches, can create
spurious errors.

The target bytecodes for deletion are in normal directories,
but not in dot started directory.

Change-Id: If79295af6c15da04017787daccfb67a9817ac27c
Fixes: bug #1532525

commit_message:
Override verify argument of generic session

Added config option to support that. It can be useful to
disable verification of certificate during generic session
creation on some deployments.

Change-Id: I99433684c72e10f5437d83e785e5ad5f049f3767
Closes-bug: 1517918
(cherry picked from commit aa57cafb6136b8c2eb80bed6a5dc70b7ae30ea40)

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-10-02 20:29:12.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/api/trove.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/databases/templates/databases/_detail_overview_redis.html', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/trove_data.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/templates/database_clusters/_detail_overview_redis.html', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/databases/db_capability.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/trove/content/database_clusters/forms.py'], 'message': 'Enable Redis database cluster support

The Launch Cluster dialog only supports datastore clusters that
Trove can deploy.  Redis clusters can now be deployed by Trove.
The Launch Cluster dialog requires the following changes for Redis.

- Customized the Launch Cluster dialog fields for Redis
- Added a new Redis specific cluster details panel.
- Modified the Trove api to specify the volume parameter in
cluster_create only if the value is greater than 0.
- Added Redis to the db_capability helper.
- Modified the Trove test data and added unit tests for the
customized fields depending on the datastore selected.

Change-Id: If43fe7d991a1646b97e8d48df789eef6fd70b460
Implements: blueprint trove-enable-redis-clustering-support
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Redis database cluster support

The Launch Cluster dialog only supports datastore clusters that
Trove can deploy.  Redis clusters can now be deployed by Trove.
The Launch Cluster dialog requires the following changes for Redis.

- Customized the Launch Cluster dialog fields for Redis
- Added a new Redis specific cluster details panel.
- Modified the Trove api to specify the volume parameter in
cluster_create only if the value is greater than 0.
- Added Redis to the db_capability helper.
- Modified the Trove test data and added unit tests for the
customized fields depending on the datastore selected.

Change-Id: If43fe7d991a1646b97e8d48df789eef6fd70b460
Implements: blueprint trove-enable-redis-clustering-support

subject: Don't store events with Gnocchi
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-01-20 00:52:26.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "Don't store events with Gnocchi

Since we move the Gnocchi configuration in Ceilometer devstack plugin
the event subsystem is enabled but unconfigured. So disable the
event subsystem by default if Gnocchi is used like before.

Change-Id: I33a6e962dcd01e12f828c4c126f6220439e5bfac
"}]
commit_message:
Don't store events with Gnocchi

Since we move the Gnocchi configuration in Ceilometer devstack plugin
the event subsystem is enabled but unconfigured. So disable the
event subsystem by default if Gnocchi is used like before.

commit_message:
Start RabbitMQ app on notify

On notify, if we detect that we are a part of a cluster we still
need to start the RabbitMQ application, because it is always
down after action_start finishes.

Closes-Bug: #1496386
Change-Id: I307452b687a6100cc4489c8decebbc3dccdbc432
