commit_message:
Enable caching for Heat validation process

Caching will provide better perfomance with work of huge Sahara clusters
on big deployments.

This feature was merged in the middle of stable liberty development.

Change-Id: I0ddb4422d0f5894c4226c9e19106fc7de110906d
Closes-bug: #1534510
(cherry picked from commit b5a06d8bec77df2ce2abbfca45e7c34dc9f6327f)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-20 10:34:48.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': "Stop filtering NVME devices by major number

Apparently, nailgun-agent filters out NVME devices due to
major number mismatch.

This wasn't an issue with kernel shipped with CentOS 6.x
where major number was 253.

For new kernel version valid major number is 259.

Change-Id: Idc572832b3a5650496439c32c0addcca4d759378
Closes-Bug: #1536055
"}]
commit_message:
Stop filtering NVME devices by major number

Apparently, nailgun-agent filters out NVME devices due to
major number mismatch.

This wasn't an issue with kernel shipped with CentOS 6.x
where major number was 253.

For new kernel version valid major number is 259.

Change-Id: Idc572832b3a5650496439c32c0addcca4d759378
Closes-Bug: #1536055

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-15 04:41:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_api.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', 'neutron/db/api.py'], 'message': "Retry port create/update on duplicate db records

Even though we have a duplicate IP check before creating an IP
allocation, there is a window between when that check is completed
and when the record is committed to the database. During this window,
another thread or server may use the same IP address, which will result
in the database commit failing with a DBDuplicateEntry exception.

This patch adds a decorator to convert the exception into a
RetryRequest, which will be caught at the API layer to start the
operation over, at which point the normal duplicate check will find
the IP and return the correct error to the user.

This was done instead of trying to convert the DBDuplicate to the
correct exception since it's on commit and there are possibly many
different sources of the duplicate record beyond the IP allocation
(depending on what mechanism drivers did during pre-commit, etc).
By retrying the request, we ensure that the prechecks run again that
will raise the appropriate exception.

Change-Id: I37a964497bf60a61bc49bdeec94a008f167c384f
Closes-Bug: #1534447
"}]
commit_message:
Retry port create/update on duplicate db records

Even though we have a duplicate IP check before creating an IP
allocation, there is a window between when that check is completed
and when the record is committed to the database. During this window,
another thread or server may use the same IP address, which will result
in the database commit failing with a DBDuplicateEntry exception.

This patch adds a decorator to convert the exception into a
RetryRequest, which will be caught at the API layer to start the
operation over, at which point the normal duplicate check will find
the IP and return the correct error to the user.

This was done instead of trying to convert the DBDuplicate to the
correct exception since it's on commit and there are possibly many
different sources of the duplicate record beyond the IP allocation
(depending on what mechanism drivers did during pre-commit, etc).
By retrying the request, we ensure that the prechecks run again that
will raise the appropriate exception.

Change-Id: I37a964497bf60a61bc49bdeec94a008f167c384f
Closes-Bug: #1534447

commit_message:
Remove 'validate' key in 'type:dict_or_nodata' type

In resource_map dict, if the 'validate' section of type:dict_or_nodata
contains 'validate' key, the validation will not be performed correctly,
because in _validate_dict_item(), it checks key name that starts with
'type:', and perform the validation.

This patch removed 'validate' key in 'external_fixed_ips' section in
neutron/extensions/l3_ext_gw_mode.py

Change-Id: I1ee49f8313bddef6f41b133f49830a8fbbe4769e
Closes-Bug: #1533518

commit_message:
Add support for Simple NFV Profile

  * This patchset implements an extensions capability to allow the
    parser to easily support additional TOSCA profiles

  * The first supported extension is the TOSCA NFV profile

Change-Id: I00606c8f0075c205da4bc221c3274e0921b630a8
Partially implements: blueprint tosca-nfv-support

commit_message:
Moving Network page tests from Nova to Neutron cluster

Due to removing Nova network support all nova-related
tests needed to be remove, but some functionality
remained not cover with UI functional tests, so
nova-related tests were removed and other are moved to
Neutron cluster

commit_message:
Fix get_subnet_for_dvr() to return correct gateway mac

Fix filters to get the right gateway port for a subnet.
Wrong filters led to random port's mac being returned which may cause
side effects. See bug for details.

Closes-Bug: #1530179
Change-Id: I8368255f00ab3e9586c8ff28dfe6739541000810

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-04 11:23:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/sanity/test_sanity.py', 'neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py'], 'message': 'Check missed ip6tables utility

In some scenario, like in OpenStack Kolla, system may lack
iptables-ipv6 package. This may cause command ip6tables-save
or ip6tables-restore invalid and ovs-agent error.

This patch allows checking ip6tables support from CLI:
    neutron-sanity-check --ip6tables_installed

Or using configuration options, for example:
    neutron-sanity-check --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
    --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini

Change-Id: Ia6cf1ed6b5033442f03eac61d2d0d783c146d797
Closes-Bug: #1530042
'}]
commit_message:
Check missed ip6tables utility

In some scenario, like in OpenStack Kolla, system may lack
iptables-ipv6 package. This may cause command ip6tables-save
or ip6tables-restore invalid and ovs-agent error.

This patch allows checking ip6tables support from CLI:
    neutron-sanity-check --ip6tables_installed

Or using configuration options, for example:
    neutron-sanity-check --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
    --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini

Change-Id: Ia6cf1ed6b5033442f03eac61d2d0d783c146d797
Closes-Bug: #1530042

commit_message:
Fix Security-rule's port should not set to 0 when Protocol is TCP/UDP

security rule port can be set value 0 when protocol is TCP/UDP

This patch add port check in def_validate_port_range(self, rule),when
protocol is TCP or UDP,port value 0 should not accepted

APIImpact
Change-Id: I57836d730db602de2a6704fd11a13c74ac38a716
Closes-Bug: #1527016

subject: Add radosgw (aka rgw) support
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-01-20 12:48:47.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/override-defaults', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/lib/ceph', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Add radosgw (aka rgw) support

This patch enables the plugin to setup ceph radosgw and configures
it as a swift-compatible endpoint with keystone integration.

ENABLE_CEPH_RGW is the new variable introduced, which is False
by default, and can be set to True in localrc if radosgw needs
to be setup.

Fixed couple of other (related) things ...
1) Created rgw specific functions
2) Checking for radosgw & swift co-existence, erroring out early enough

NOTE: Tested on ubuntu trusty only

TODOs ...
1) Not tested on Fedora (F22), radosgw startup has some issues there.

Co-Authored-By: Deepak C Shetty <deepakcs@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I21db4168eb69d107599f6b6ab1668b02b764b2c6
'}]
commit_message:
Add radosgw (aka rgw) support

This patch enables the plugin to setup ceph radosgw and configures
it as a swift-compatible endpoint with keystone integration.

ENABLE_CEPH_RGW is the new variable introduced, which is False
by default, and can be set to True in localrc if radosgw needs
to be setup.

Fixed couple of other (related) things ...
1) Created rgw specific functions
2) Checking for radosgw & swift co-existence, erroring out early enough

NOTE: Tested on ubuntu trusty only

TODOs ...
1) Not tested on Fedora (F22), radosgw startup has some issues there.

Co-Authored-By: Deepak C Shetty <deepakcs@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I21db4168eb69d107599f6b6ab1668b02b764b2c6

commit_message:
Fix argument order for assertEqual to (expected, observed)

assertEqual expects that the arguments provided to it should be (expected, observed).
If a particluar order is kept as a convention, then it helps to provide a cleaner
message to the developer if Unit Tests fail.
The following patch fixes this issue

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I164dd6b2b820e4ca26bf3406f591ca786893f279
Closes-Bug: #1259292
Closes-Bug: #1277104

Due to Bug 1499620, the Liberty UCA neutron fails to start when syslog
is enabled. This change disables syslog for neutron when using
$::os_package_type is set to ubuntu.  As a work around until UCA fixes

Partial-Blueprint: deploy-with-uca-packages

commit_message:
Disable syslog for neutron for UCA

Due to Bug 1499620, the Liberty UCA neutron fails to start when syslog
is enabled. This change disables syslog for neutron when using
$::os_package_type is set to ubuntu.  As a work around until UCA fixes
liberty, we need to disable syslog for neutron.

Change-Id: I1463c1742d890c4d79182ce0335422f48c53453a
Partial-Blueprint: deploy-with-uca-packages

when creating macvtap passthrough to SR-IOV VF in Kernel >= 3.13 an
upper_macvtap symbolic link is created. For Kernel < 3.13 the only
way to know it is by parsing the ip link show output and look for
macvtap[0-9]+@<vf ifname>.

This patch used the ip link show command to detects
macvtap assigned vf so that detection of macvtap assigned vf
will work on all kernels

Closes-Bug: #1523083
Change-Id: Icbc8d6af5c00d1453095e04dd779210dc7244c7f
'}]
commit_message:
SR-IOV: Fix macvtap assigned vf check when kernel < 3.13

when creating macvtap passthrough to SR-IOV VF in Kernel >= 3.13 an
upper_macvtap symbolic link is created. For Kernel < 3.13 the only
way to know it is by parsing the ip link show output and look for
macvtap[0-9]+@<vf ifname>.

This patch used the ip link show command to detects
macvtap assigned vf so that detection of macvtap assigned vf
will work on all kernels

Closes-Bug: #1523083
Change-Id: Icbc8d6af5c00d1453095e04dd779210dc7244c7f

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-30 22:08:23.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/keystone.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/keystone/keystone_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Configure keystone cache memcache servers

This change properly configures the cache/memcache_servers configuration
for keystone. Due to an upstream keystone module bug, this setting is
not properly configured and there is no support for configuring it
within the keystone module at this time. Without this setting, the
keystone cache is enabled without properly configuring the memcache
servers which results in errors and excessive backend communications.

Change-Id: I6ca90dfb32c824aeff8022ba70d7b988edae6486
Partial-Bug: #1530178
'}]
commit_message:
Configure keystone cache memcache servers

This change properly configures the cache/memcache_servers configuration
for keystone. Due to an upstream keystone module bug, this setting is
not properly configured and there is no support for configuring it
within the keystone module at this time. Without this setting, the
keystone cache is enabled without properly configuring the memcache
servers which results in errors and excessive backend communications.

Change-Id: I6ca90dfb32c824aeff8022ba70d7b988edae6486
Partial-Bug: #1530178

commit_message:
Corrected wrong ethertype exception message

This patch resolves the issue where wrong message was being
shown when ethertype input parameter was not amongst one of
the types supported. New message made akin to other input
parameters like 'protocol'.

Change-Id: I5636f3582c9d9877dad4d091a374284b656923f4
Closes-Bug: #1508106

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 10:12:25.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore'], 'message': 'Gitignore theme directory, except default/material

Alternate themes are useful for testing and other customisations.
Rather than using global git excludes or other workarounds, we should
just exclude the themes directory except for the "default" theme and
the alternate "material" example theme.

Change-Id: Ie88524ca5016135591b041ea13f02d62ff25dabc
Closes-Bug: 1536087
'}]
commit_message:
Gitignore theme directory, except default/material

Alternate themes are useful for testing and other customisations.
Rather than using global git excludes or other workarounds, we should
just exclude the themes directory except for the "default" theme and
the alternate "material" example theme.

Change-Id: Ie88524ca5016135591b041ea13f02d62ff25dabc
Closes-Bug: 1536087

Fix wrong commandment number

The check_assertempty method uses N330 but it's not defined
in HACKING.rst. It also should point N328 because it checks
the wrong use of assertEqual.

commit_message:
Replace usage hiera() to hiera_hash() for all network_scheme lookups

Lokup by hiera() makes impossible to change network_scheme from plugin tasks.

Change-Id: I9f034906bb382db13c83e5d320e33800357d72b7

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-03 10:52:26.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/software_deployment.py', 'heat/engine/cfn/functions.py', 'heat/tests/test_software_deployment.py'], 'message': 'Resolve attributes for Software Deployment Group

The patch introduces the mechanism that allows to show all

It also deletes the custom implementation of FnGetAtt from
SoftwareDeploymentGroup and uses the FnGetAtt from

Closes-bug: #1470675

commit_message:
Resolve attributes for Software Deployment Group

The patch introduces the mechanism that allows to show all
attributes of Software Deployment Group in stack output.
It also deletes the custom implementation of FnGetAtt from
SoftwareDeploymentGroup and uses the FnGetAtt from
the parent resource instead.

Closes-bug: #1470675

Change-Id: I7cfe0be9a58859783bc3786cf291215836fc1e46

commit_message:
Enable caching for Heat validation process

Caching will provide better perfomance with work of huge Sahara clusters
on big deployments.

This feature was merged in the middle of stable liberty development.

Change-Id: I0ddb4422d0f5894c4226c9e19106fc7de110906d
Closes-bug: #1534510

The patch introduces DynamicScheme attributes for heat resources.
It also replaces FnGetAttr function for some resources
(SoftwareDeployment, StackResources, AWS nested stack) and
introduces _resolve_attribute that allows to use all attributes
of these resources in stack outputs.

Partial-Bug: #1470675

commit_message:
Replace FnGetAttr from Stack resource with _resolve_attribute

The patch introduces DynamicScheme attributes for heat resources.
It also replaces FnGetAttr function for some resources
(SoftwareDeployment, StackResources, AWS nested stack) and
introduces _resolve_attribute that allows to use all attributes
of these resources in stack outputs.

Change-Id: Ib721c1d8bd4a9f10190a0930910bb9e0d34cae1c
Partial-Bug: #1470675

commit_message:
Disable execution of dbsync for Murano Dashboard

Since Horizon uses memcache as session engine in MOS,
we need to disable execution of dbsync for Murano Dashboard.

Change-Id: I57e03734720e3dd35cdfce6ed628171ac398456a
Closes-Bug: #1527478

commit_message:
Add cinder-block-device to group for common tasks

Without this change cinder-block-device as stand-alone node will not
work, because of lack all needed interfaces, unconfigured logging and etc.

Change-Id: Ief21fe7887d12050640dd5eecc13cc3eba44a32f
Closes-bug: #1533700
(cherry picked from commit 4ac516acf6430a2915a7ac62588015d7cdabfdb5)

Enable active connection closing for ceilometer-api

Enable active connection closing after response
is transferred for ceilometer API requests.
Enable httplog option for ceilometer-api as well.

Closes-bug: #1533680

commit_message:
Replace usage hiera() to hiera_hash() for all network_scheme lookups

Lokup by hiera() makes impossible to change network_scheme from plugin tasks.

Change-Id: I9f034906bb382db13c83e5d320e33800357d72b7
Closes-bug: #1535679

commit_message:
Attaching a default project_id

Zaqar client threw below exception for noauth backend.

MalformedRequest: The header X-PROJECT-ID was missing

This patch will add a default project_id in request header
for noauth authentication backend.

Closes-Bug: #1494154

Change-Id: I2e56654846a41ea136e4c06cd1daf697683aed46

subject: update min tox to 2.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 21:22:23.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "update min tox to 2.0

This bumps the min tox to 2.0, as the construct:

 # 'all' includes slow tests
 setenv = {[tempestenv]setenv}
         OS_TEST_TIMEOUT={env:OS_TEST_TIMEOUT:1200}

Does not work on tox 1.6 (it does on 2.0). 2.0 is also what's required
for constraints env overrides, so probably the correct new minimum.

Change-Id: I1826cfbc7e838aca46a955dfe61fed667b3c339e
"}]
commit_message:
update min tox to 2.0

This bumps the min tox to 2.0, as the construct:

 # 'all' includes slow tests
 setenv = {[tempestenv]setenv}
         OS_TEST_TIMEOUT={env:OS_TEST_TIMEOUT:1200}

Does not work on tox 1.6 (it does on 2.0). 2.0 is also what's required
for constraints env overrides, so probably the correct new minimum.

Change-Id: I1826cfbc7e838aca46a955dfe61fed667b3c339e

subject: Add listing target
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-20 11:02:41.000000000', 'files': ['iso/module.mk', 'prepare-build-env.sh'], 'message': "Add listing target

This new 'listing' target puts lists of
files in $(BUILD_DIR) and in local_mirror
to files, so to use them to identify the content of the ISO.

It also finds all fuel related rpm packages that are put into the ISO
and puts their changelog into listing-package-changelog.txt
file. This file can be used to identify SHA sums
of repos that are used to build corresponding packages.

Change-Id: I4738cea6fbd9539b945607943f3bcaf1c0554057
Related-Bug: #1515517
"}]
commit_message:
Add listing target

This new 'listing' target puts lists of
files in $(BUILD_DIR) and in local_mirror
to files, so to use them to identify the content of the ISO.

It also finds all fuel related rpm packages that are put into the ISO
and puts their changelog into listing-package-changelog.txt
file. This file can be used to identify SHA sums
of repos that are used to build corresponding packages.

Change-Id: I4738cea6fbd9539b945607943f3bcaf1c0554057
Related-Bug: #1515517

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-19 15:05:39.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-notes/V-38575.rst', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Disable auditd rules for deletions

The rules recommended by the STIG for monitoring deleted
files/directories causes significant load during OpenStack-Ansible
deployments and during package updates. This is a blocker for
integrating openstack-ansible-security with AIO builds in
OpenStack-Ansible.

Closes-Bug: 1535463

Change-Id: I5db355ad1b006da1cab2fafa09e415666b6d5f90
'}]
commit_message:
Disable auditd rules for deletions

The rules recommended by the STIG for monitoring deleted
files/directories causes significant load during OpenStack-Ansible
deployments and during package updates. This is a blocker for
integrating openstack-ansible-security with AIO builds in
OpenStack-Ansible.

Closes-Bug: 1535463

Change-Id: I5db355ad1b006da1cab2fafa09e415666b6d5f90

commit_message:
Fix configuration merging for multiple roles

Serializer used incorrect logic to merge configuration
dictionaries. It did merging on the first nesting level
while it is required to do it on the second.

Change-Id: I1ef13bc80098d6e9b1f450ea35d4ec8b32d6171d
Closes-Bug: #1524284

subject: Don't log non-db error in retry wrapper
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-13 22:20:57.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/api.py', 'oslo_db/tests/test_api.py'], 'message': "Don't log non-db error in retry wrapper

838e314a21fef9ca6cf99140b2400e0d3b68b109 changed the retry wrapper
code to not log exception traces for expected errors, like when
retrying on a DBDeadlock. It did, however, log an unexpected exception
but was not checking the type, like in the case of a nova OverQuota
exception.

Since _is_execption_expected already logs at debug level an expected
DB error, like DBDeadlock, during a retry loop, we don't need to log
it again. And if the exception is unexpected, like OverQuota from nova,
then we shouldn't trace that exception in the retry loop before
reraising but instead just let the caller handle it.

Adds a unit test to make sure that nothing is logged in the unexpected
exception case during the retry loop.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: Ic3e45029378dc96ce01398d9b55f51e20ef08189
Closes-Bug: #1532880
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log non-db error in retry wrapper

838e314a21fef9ca6cf99140b2400e0d3b68b109 changed the retry wrapper
code to not log exception traces for expected errors, like when
retrying on a DBDeadlock. It did, however, log an unexpected exception
but was not checking the type, like in the case of a nova OverQuota
exception.

Since _is_execption_expected already logs at debug level an expected
DB error, like DBDeadlock, during a retry loop, we don't need to log
it again. And if the exception is unexpected, like OverQuota from nova,
then we shouldn't trace that exception in the retry loop before
reraising but instead just let the caller handle it.

Adds a unit test to make sure that nothing is logged in the unexpected
exception case during the retry loop.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>

Change-Id: Ic3e45029378dc96ce01398d9b55f51e20ef08189
Closes-Bug: #1532880

it was called later by coverage.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-10-23 10:51:24.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/default_configs.py', 'openstack_health/api.py', 'openstack_health/tests/test_configs.py', 'README.rst', 'etc/openstack-health-api.conf', 'openstack_health/factory.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Change the api config loading

As we should support different configurations for the api in each
environment, this changes the way we load the Flask configs. Based on
Flask recomendations [1], now the default configs is defined in a
standard Python module and if any of them must be overrided in some
environment, a new config file must be specified in an environment
variable. The proper instructions were added to the readme file.

As the function to create the Flask app became little bigger, it was
moved to a factory module mostly to keep each module simple.

Also, as the old config file is not necessary anymore, it was deleted.

[1] http://flask.pocoo.org/docs/0.10/config/#configuring-from-files

Change-Id: I52313b212bc19fdf6d89f60c50435f218a143118
'}]
commit_message:
Change the api config loading

As we should support different configurations for the api in each
environment, this changes the way we load the Flask configs. Based on
Flask recomendations [1], now the default configs is defined in a
standard Python module and if any of them must be overrided in some
environment, a new config file must be specified in an environment
variable. The proper instructions were added to the readme file.

As the function to create the Flask app became little bigger, it was
moved to a factory module mostly to keep each module simple.

Also, as the old config file is not necessary anymore, it was deleted.

[1] http://flask.pocoo.org/docs/0.10/config/#configuring-from-files

Change-Id: I52313b212bc19fdf6d89f60c50435f218a143118

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-01-14 16:00:56.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Set BUILD status for ports right after update in DB

In case agent notification is needed after port update it is fair
to set BUILD status for the port as in fact agent needs to
process it before we can say this port is actual and active.
This fixes the bug when nova thinks it should not wait for any events
from neutron because all ports are already active.

L2 pop mech driver was updated to remove fdb entries for migrated
ports when their status changes from BUILD to ACTIVE - when l3 agent
reports that device is active. Originally fdb entries were removed
when ports status changed to BUILD (agent requests info for the port)
which seems too early (and becomes even more early with the patch).

Closes-Bug: #1522824
Related-Bug: #1450604
Change-Id: I2df34d7ccf7bd45a8d7e992a1c394453f0956612
'}]
commit_message:
Set BUILD status for ports right after update in DB

In case agent notification is needed after port update it is fair
to set BUILD status for the port as in fact agent needs to
process it before we can say this port is actual and active.
This fixes the bug when nova thinks it should not wait for any events
from neutron because all ports are already active.

L2 pop mech driver was updated to remove fdb entries for migrated
ports when their status changes from BUILD to ACTIVE - when l3 agent
reports that device is active. Originally fdb entries were removed
when ports status changed to BUILD (agent requests info for the port)
which seems too early (and becomes even more early with the patch).

Closes-Bug: #1522824
Related-Bug: #1450604
Change-Id: I2df34d7ccf7bd45a8d7e992a1c394453f0956612

Horizon has removed Saharaclient and Troveclient from its dependencies,
so, remove their code from Manila-UI too.
Latest release of Manilaclient v1.6.0 broke possibility to import
deprecated v1 API modules having b_u_g 1535692. So, change usage of

Closes-Bug: #1535657

commit_message:
Fix compatibility with Manilaclient and Horizon

Horizon has removed Saharaclient and Troveclient from its dependencies,
so, remove their code from Manila-UI too.
Latest release of Manilaclient v1.6.0 broke possibility to import
deprecated v1 API modules having b_u_g 1535692. So, change usage of
manilaclient in the way when we do not hit that bug.

Change-Id: I907502a6dcb9ff8521935428bbb34b930b134553
Closes-Bug: #1535657

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-09 12:23:16.000000000', 'files': ['fuelmenu/fuelmenu/fuelmenu.py', 'fuelmenu/fuelmenu/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Disable --save-only mode during post-deployment

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242109/
(full link because fuelmenu now lives in a new gitrepo)

It is common for users to run bootstrap_admin_node to apply
a patch to Fuel Master, which has the side effect of calling
fuelmenu --save-only --iface=ethN. This behavior initializes
all fields to defaults, which has negative consequences.

Now fuelmenu --save-only --iface=ethN will result in a message
saying that the user should run full fuelmenu in order to make
changes.

Change-Id: I78d3261a5e2700b7533d9873f6bec9cc4e98c362
Closes-Bug: #1513486
'}]
commit_message:
Disable --save-only mode during post-deployment

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242109/
(full link because fuelmenu now lives in a new gitrepo)

It is common for users to run bootstrap_admin_node to apply
a patch to Fuel Master, which has the side effect of calling
fuelmenu --save-only --iface=ethN. This behavior initializes
all fields to defaults, which has negative consequences.

Now fuelmenu --save-only --iface=ethN will result in a message
saying that the user should run full fuelmenu in order to make
changes.

Change-Id: I78d3261a5e2700b7533d9873f6bec9cc4e98c362
Closes-Bug: #1513486

commit_message:
Attempt to delete internal resources if create server fail

Attempt to delete queue/user/internal_ports if server hasn't
been created successful yet, to avoid some infos residue.

commit_message:
Remove public_endpoint definition

Mitaka manifests treat false as a string False, rather
than unsetting the value. This parameter is no longer
used, so it should be simply removed.

blueprint puppet-mitaka

Change-Id: I3b8a0b22a4ed4a67cc6ee17a8f2b0281ac9249c4

commit_message:
Properly handle bonds with associated bridges and VLAN-tagged interfaces

When a bond has a bridge associated with it and other VLAN-tagged interfaces on
different bridges then it is neccesary to retrieve informtion about the bond
by bridge name rather than by bond name.

Change-Id: Ife0e085c7be212798139a777691528579939eb82
Closes-bug: #1532810

This patch follows the CoreOS guidance for kubernetes:
https://coreos.com/kubernetes/docs/latest/getting-started.html

CoreOS doesn't support multi-part mime user-data, so we cannot pack
multiple scripts into one (which we did in Atomic). The major work of
this patch is to wrap each cloud-init script with a systemd unit,
which will be executed one-by-one at the first boot.

Note that this patch only enable a basic CoreOS support. Advanced
features (i.e. TLS, Cinder volume, HA, external load balancing) are
not included. These features need to be ported from Atomic as a
future work.

Partially-Implements: blueprint coreos-k8s-bay
Change-Id: Ib6fe76718ac9b198e0aae57618d3edd98792f15d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the CoreOS Heat templates

This patch follows the CoreOS guidance for kubernetes:
https://coreos.com/kubernetes/docs/latest/getting-started.html

CoreOS doesn't support multi-part mime user-data, so we cannot pack
multiple scripts into one (which we did in Atomic). The major work of
this patch is to wrap each cloud-init script with a systemd unit,
which will be executed one-by-one at the first boot.

Note that this patch only enable a basic CoreOS support. Advanced
features (i.e. TLS, Cinder volume, HA, external load balancing) are
not included. These features need to be ported from Atomic as a
future work.

Partially-Implements: blueprint coreos-k8s-bay
Change-Id: Ib6fe76718ac9b198e0aae57618d3edd98792f15d

subject: Allow adding new overcloud passwords
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11997, 'name': 'Lennart Regebro', 'email': 'lregebro@redhat.com', 'username': 'lregebro'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-15 13:03:49.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Allow adding new overcloud passwords

The current implementation of the password generation function is
all or nothing.  If the file exists, then it uses that file as the
list of passwords, otherwise it generates an entirely new file.

This means that if we add a new service that requires a password to
be generated and a user upgrades with a password file generated by
an older version, we will not generate a new password for the new
service and pandemonium will result.

To address the problem, read in any existing passwords from the file,
but loop through the names to make sure all of the expected passwords
are set.  If any are not, generate them.  Behavior in the case of
no password file remains unchanged.

Change-Id: Id9c5fe363a2aef55800bee4db12cbf3e2d278e45
'}]
commit_message:
Allow adding new overcloud passwords

The current implementation of the password generation function is
all or nothing.  If the file exists, then it uses that file as the
list of passwords, otherwise it generates an entirely new file.

This means that if we add a new service that requires a password to
be generated and a user upgrades with a password file generated by
an older version, we will not generate a new password for the new
service and pandemonium will result.

To address the problem, read in any existing passwords from the file,
but loop through the names to make sure all of the expected passwords
are set.  If any are not, generate them.  Behavior in the case of
no password file remains unchanged.

Change-Id: Id9c5fe363a2aef55800bee4db12cbf3e2d278e45

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-05 10:53:09.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': 'Wait for cluster to settle in yum_update.sh

Occasionally we hit "Error: unable to push cib" during update. This is
probably due to the fact that when we try to replace cib in
yum_update.sh, services on the previous updated controller are still
coming up and changing cib, and racing/conflicting with the cib push
from yum_update.sh.

This commit adds waiting for the cluster to settle before exiting from
yum_update.sh, to avoid this kind of conflict.

Also a check for cib-push success is added, to make the update fail
properly instead of hanging indefinitely as we've observed with this
issue.

Change-Id: I953087e0e565474ac553fd57bea2459d2e3a6081
Closes-Bug: #1527644
(cherry picked from commit ac7467bacddb98fbb9fc9716ba56cad0d6f282de)
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for cluster to settle in yum_update.sh

Occasionally we hit "Error: unable to push cib" during update. This is
probably due to the fact that when we try to replace cib in
yum_update.sh, services on the previous updated controller are still
coming up and changing cib, and racing/conflicting with the cib push
from yum_update.sh.

This commit adds waiting for the cluster to settle before exiting from
yum_update.sh, to avoid this kind of conflict.

Also a check for cib-push success is added, to make the update fail
properly instead of hanging indefinitely as we've observed with this
issue.

Change-Id: I953087e0e565474ac553fd57bea2459d2e3a6081
Closes-Bug: #1527644
(cherry picked from commit ac7467bacddb98fbb9fc9716ba56cad0d6f282de)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11997, 'name': 'Lennart Regebro', 'email': 'lregebro@redhat.com', 'username': 'lregebro'}, {'_account_id': 12321, 'name': 'Ryan Brown', 'email': 'rybrown@redhat.com', 'username': 'ryansb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-19 17:46:26.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Allow adding new overcloud passwords

The current implementation of the password generation function is
all or nothing.  If the file exists, then it uses that file as the
list of passwords, otherwise it generates an entirely new file.

This means that if we add a new service that requires a password to
be generated and a user upgrades with a password file generated by
an older version, we will not generate a new password for the new
service and pandemonium will result.

To address the problem, read in any existing passwords from the file,
but loop through the names to make sure all of the expected passwords
are set.  If any are not, generate them.  Behavior in the case of
no password file remains unchanged.

Change-Id: Id9c5fe363a2aef55800bee4db12cbf3e2d278e45
'}]
commit_message:
Allow adding new overcloud passwords

The current implementation of the password generation function is
all or nothing.  If the file exists, then it uses that file as the
list of passwords, otherwise it generates an entirely new file.

This means that if we add a new service that requires a password to
be generated and a user upgrades with a password file generated by
an older version, we will not generate a new password for the new
service and pandemonium will result.

To address the problem, read in any existing passwords from the file,
but loop through the names to make sure all of the expected passwords
are set.  If any are not, generate them.  Behavior in the case of
no password file remains unchanged.

Change-Id: Id9c5fe363a2aef55800bee4db12cbf3e2d278e45

subject: Sheepdog: Change storelocation format
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-12-10 09:42:56.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/sheepdog.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_sheepdog_store.py'], 'message': "Sheepdog: Change storelocation format

This patch changes storelocation format from 'sheepdog://image' to
'sheepdog://addr:port:image'. It add ip and port to the location.
This offers the advantages of:

1.The ip and port represents a sheepdog cluster which contains the
image. The format like 'sheepdog://addr:port:image' can describe image
location accurately.

2.When clone an image in cinder, it need ip and port to decide whether
the image is in the same sheepdog cluster with cinder-backend, this is
very important for us to determine if the image is cloneable.

This patch also change a long data type to int to compatible with
python version 3.x.

Change-Id: Id79487e05e3af2f7b1287476ddbb174ad9de78c8
"}]
commit_message:
Sheepdog: Change storelocation format

This patch changes storelocation format from 'sheepdog://image' to
'sheepdog://addr:port:image'. It add ip and port to the location.
This offers the advantages of:

1.The ip and port represents a sheepdog cluster which contains the
image. The format like 'sheepdog://addr:port:image' can describe image
location accurately.

2.When clone an image in cinder, it need ip and port to decide whether
the image is in the same sheepdog cluster with cinder-backend, this is
very important for us to determine if the image is cloneable.

This patch also change a long data type to int to compatible with
python version 3.x.

Change-Id: Id79487e05e3af2f7b1287476ddbb174ad9de78c8

commit_message:
Add refresh_zone_data method to update cluster zone info

In placement policy we should not only create placement plan, but
also store the zone information in cluster data. This data is in
the following format and will be used by deletion policy to make
deletion stragety.
cluster.data = {
    'az1': 10,
    'az2': 20,
}

Change-Id: Ia615584af75b2e07d21f91068995e7fe088c567a
Implements: blueprint cross-az-region-deletion-policy

erase_devices step abortable. Erasing devices is something that can be
cancelled without damaging the machine.

commit_message:
Make the erase_devices clean step abortable

This patches updates the get_clean_steps() method to make the
erase_devices step abortable. Erasing devices is something that can be
cancelled without damaging the machine.

When a clean step is aborted the provision state of the Ironic node
will go to CLEANFAIL state. The operator can then do what is needed to
fix the problem (i.e network booting issues) and restart the cleaning
later on.

Partial-Bug: #1455825
Change-Id: Ic181ac3712810c6f6925e8b627ee79e77ecf4d83

revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2015-09-21 19:08:19.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/versions.py', 'ironic/drivers/base.py', 'doc/source/webapi/v1.rst', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_base.py', 'ironic/tests/api/v1/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/common/states.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'message': 'Allow abort for CLEANWAIT states

This patch allows a node in CLEANWAIT to be aborted.

The @clean_step decorator has been extended to accept a new parameter
"abortable". By default this parameter defaults to False since a clean
step could potentially brick a machine so we better make it explicit.

If the clean step is abortable, the process of aborting will happen
immediately; if the clean step is not abortable the abortion will happen
as soon as the clean step is done. If a clean step is marked to have
the abortion done after its completion but it is the final clean step in
the cleaning operation the cleaning process will just finish successfully.

A new verb 'abort' is being added to the API and the microversion is
being bumped to 1.13.

Closes-Bug: #1455825
Change-Id: Ia6846c048b3dab44a8280366a7305aca1d3eb783
'}]
commit_message:
Allow abort for CLEANWAIT states

This patch allows a node in CLEANWAIT to be aborted.

The @clean_step decorator has been extended to accept a new parameter
"abortable". By default this parameter defaults to False since a clean
step could potentially brick a machine so we better make it explicit.

If the clean step is abortable, the process of aborting will happen
immediately; if the clean step is not abortable the abortion will happen
as soon as the clean step is done. If a clean step is marked to have
the abortion done after its completion but it is the final clean step in
the cleaning operation the cleaning process will just finish successfully.

A new verb 'abort' is being added to the API and the microversion is
being bumped to 1.13.

Closes-Bug: #1455825
Change-Id: Ia6846c048b3dab44a8280366a7305aca1d3eb783

commit_message:
Add CLEANWAIT state

This patch adds the CLEANWAIT state. When a node is in CLEANWAIT means
that the ramdisk is executing a clean step (async). When the node is
in CLEANING state it means that the conductor is executing a clean step
(sync).

This is the first patch of a series that aim to make nodes in CLEANWAIT
abortable. We still need a way need some way to tell if a step is
abortable; aborting steps could have negative effects such as bricking
things.

Depends-On: I195ecd90e7e4165504da5ac330cee3fc7c3039c2
Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>
Partial-Bug: #1455825
Change-Id: Ic2bc4f147f68947f53d341fda5e0c8d7b594a553

commit_message:
Enable loadbalancer with ssl on undercloud

When an ssl certificate is configured, configures haproxy with said
certificate in front of the public API endpoints for the services.
If no certificate is configured, leaves everything setup as before.

Change-Id: Idd9492303e797f5b39c980772f33754fb44a9f12
(cherry picked from commit 1f17076e09a7813dbf4b5de047f981c9fada552c)

commit_message:
Remove purge_deleted from senlin-manage

We now don't have support to soft-delete in database, so the
purge_deleted command doesn't make any senses. This patch removes it.

Change-Id: I1b3e69524dd497e6d7bf74abeabe0e81889b543f

commit_message:
Fix E713 and F811 errors in tacker code

This Patch fixes all E713 and F811 errors and
enables this test for all new patches to tacker.

E713 test for membership should be ‘not in’
F811 redefinition of unused variable

see OpenStack Style Guidelines
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/

Change-Id: I2f73c11bb5f89b3d3c2a85417ad5098fd21e580d
Related-Bug: 1515930

commit_message:
Minor refactor

1. SingletonMeta -> modified to allow handling multiple classes and moved to metaclasses too.
2. @logwrap : process asserts too

Changes reason:
 @logwrap was changed during test debug (was assert in wrapped function
 and stacktrace was not enough for reason understand) and moved out of
 test changest due to not mandatory for this test.
 Pros: Now assert, raised in wrapped function is recorded in log with
 details.

 SingletonMeta: was changed as "nice to have" during work on plugin
 helpers. Later plugin helpers was moved out of SshManager, and all code
 changes was moved to this changeset.
 Pros: Single way for handling the same tasks in different places.
 Previously SshManager used Metaclass, which could not be reused for
 more, than one class and Environment used __new__ directly written
 in class code.

Related-Bug: #1518979
Related-Bug: #1519050

Change-Id: I798302879400747909229cc208f97a669f25bbf3

from a new plugin entry point. The new test also improve on the

import xml.sax # issue found OK
from xml import sax # no issue found, wrong

Finally, this patch removes the use of filename style wild cards
such as * from the import blacklist matching, as this was not being

commit_message:
Breaking out blacklists

This change removes the old blacklist plugins and replaces them
with new built in functionality that loads blacklist item data
from a new plugin entry point. The new test also improve on the
old functionality that was broken in the following way:

import xml.sax # issue found OK
from xml import sax # no issue found, wrong

Finally, this patch removes the use of filename style wild cards
such as * from the import blacklist matching, as this was not being
used. Both this test and the old ones will alert on any import from
within the blacklisted namespace.

Change-Id: I98af6daf3c54561c0e4b399605ea615b42b7b283

commit_message:
Fix endpoint_types

Endpoint types does not get set as when the shell creates the client
object the endpoint_type is not passed.

This causes the client to default the endpoint type to 'public'.

This change passes endpoint_type from the shell to the client.

Change-Id: I12afb072174d25152223a77601546ed26b5e5b62
Closes-Bug: 1535396

subject: Remove keypair ID from details table
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-19 11:33:19.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/keypairs/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/templates/access_and_security/keypairs/detail.html'], 'message': 'Remove keypair ID from details table

Currently Horizon shows keypdair.id in
project->compute->access&security->keypairs
-> keypair details tab.
But python-novaclient always returns
keypair.id=keypair.name.

Right now Nova sends ID in its response and python-novaclient got it,
but python-novaclient does not pass that ID into the Horizon.
And keypair-id is also shown via nova-cli.
But Nova folks says that ID is a some kind of private atrtr in Nova,
and that fact it is shown via cli is a side-effect and should be fiexed.

So, Horizon should not use keypair-id and this patch removes it.

Change-Id: Idd13b8900342fb98675fc8c98fff016109d8161b
Closes-Bug: #1527257
'}]
commit_message:
Remove keypair ID from details table

Currently Horizon shows keypdair.id in
project->compute->access&security->keypairs
-> keypair details tab.
But python-novaclient always returns
keypair.id=keypair.name.

Right now Nova sends ID in its response and python-novaclient got it,
but python-novaclient does not pass that ID into the Horizon.
And keypair-id is also shown via nova-cli.
But Nova folks says that ID is a some kind of private atrtr in Nova,
and that fact it is shown via cli is a side-effect and should be fiexed.

So, Horizon should not use keypair-id and this patch removes it.

Change-Id: Idd13b8900342fb98675fc8c98fff016109d8161b
Closes-Bug: #1527257

commit_message:
Check the location url before update

When the image's locations are changed, the image_locations table
in db will be changed as well even though it raises errors during
the update action. So we need check the location url before update
to ensure the location change is effective.

Change-Id: Iba514d3c4b964bd581a46eb89351e06aa2543360
Closes-bug: #1529572

subject: Hash domains by name
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 9060, 'name': 'Mike Dorman', 'email': 'dorm@dorm.org', 'username': 'gd-mdorman'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}, {'_account_id': 9983, 'name': 'Richard Megginson', 'email': 'rmeggins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rmeggins'}, {'_account_id': 10540, 'name': "Clayton O'Neill", 'email': 'clayton.oneill@charter.com', 'username': 'coneill'}, {'_account_id': 16771, 'name': 'mpolenchuk', 'email': 'mpolenchuk@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mpolenchuk'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-18 13:57:20.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Hash domains by name

Currently every project and user resource generates a call to
fetch_domain, which is an unhashed query to the openstack domain show
command. This is very wasteful and does not scale well. This patch takes
the code that hashes domains by id and generates an inverse, a hash of
domains by name. This code is used in place of fetch_domain, which is
removed. Since the only thing used in this hash is the id, which should
be immutable, we should not have issues with the other fields changing
(like description and enabled).

This should provide a performance boost to users who have a lot of users
and projects, especially if everything is in the default domain.

Co-Authored-By: Denis Egorenko <degorenko@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I99d8fe272aedc0cbc6ad48561ea50a7b7d6cdb1e
'}]
commit_message:
Hash domains by name

Currently every project and user resource generates a call to
fetch_domain, which is an unhashed query to the openstack domain show
command. This is very wasteful and does not scale well. This patch takes
the code that hashes domains by id and generates an inverse, a hash of
domains by name. This code is used in place of fetch_domain, which is
removed. Since the only thing used in this hash is the id, which should
be immutable, we should not have issues with the other fields changing
(like description and enabled).

This should provide a performance boost to users who have a lot of users
and projects, especially if everything is in the default domain.

Co-Authored-By: Denis Egorenko <degorenko@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I99d8fe272aedc0cbc6ad48561ea50a7b7d6cdb1e

subject: test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-18 07:39:59.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/base.py', 'gnocchi/indexer/sqlalchemy.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_storage.py'], 'message': "test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

each config option has limitation for type and value. In production
code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input is valid, but in unit test,
test methods can pass if we use method CONF.set_override without
parameter enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong value
to config option. This commit makes sure calling method
CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True

Change-Id: Iac8cc0f655e96d66bf9701be4791f310631788a5
Related-Bug: #1517839
"}]
commit_message:
test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

each config option has limitation for type and value. In production
code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input is valid, but in unit test,
test methods can pass if we use method CONF.set_override without
parameter enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong value
to config option. This commit makes sure calling method
CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True

Change-Id: Iac8cc0f655e96d66bf9701be4791f310631788a5
Related-Bug: #1517839

Before allocate_for_instance updates the net information cache,
the cache has likely beeen updated with the net information
by other threads. This will lead to duplicate nics stored
into cache.

entries in net cache.

Closes-bug: 1515768
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the duplicate nics for VMs

Before allocate_for_instance updates the net information cache,
the cache has likely beeen updated with the net information
by other threads. This will lead to duplicate nics stored
into cache.

This patch removes the old net cache entries to avoid duplicate
entries in net cache.

Change-Id: I0753f148cca1a49df4d0fee38cbe8771982325f5
Closes-bug: 1515768

commit_message:
Replace string format arguments with function parameters

There are files containing string format arguments inside logging
messages. Using logging function parameters should be preferred.
Details available at http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0282/.

Also, move log.debug() to neutronclient.shell module to make sure
all commands have log.debug in run() to keep consistent.

Based on the work of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/94345/

Change-Id: Ic64857878069357b2fcc0db0755d82e492dcca15
Closes-Bug: #1321754

subject: Cap virtualenv<14
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-20 02:50:30.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Cap virtualenv<14

Pip 8 was just released and now makes uninstalling distutils installed
packages fatal and this breaks a lot of things. We need to cap pip<8
however, virtualenv 14 was released in tandem and bundles pip8. So
when we install virtualenv 14 this breaks the kilo jobs. Liberty and
master don't have this issue because of constraints.

Change-Id: I41852343a0606bd5b2cc76c98507e9ede7381696
"}]
commit_message:
Cap virtualenv<14

Pip 8 was just released and now makes uninstalling distutils installed
packages fatal and this breaks a lot of things. We need to cap pip<8
however, virtualenv 14 was released in tandem and bundles pip8. So
when we install virtualenv 14 this breaks the kilo jobs. Liberty and
master don't have this issue because of constraints.

Change-Id: I41852343a0606bd5b2cc76c98507e9ede7381696

subject: Get Accounts by Cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-08 03:42:45.000000000', 'files': ['examples/basic-account-watcher/LICENSE', 'swift/account/auditor.py', 'swift/common/middleware/recon.py', 'examples/basic-account-watcher/README.md', 'examples/basic-account-watcher/account_watcher/__init__.py', 'swift/cli/recon.py', 'examples/basic-account-watcher/setup.py', 'test/unit/account/test_auditor.py'], 'message': 'Get Accounts by Cluster

Cluster operators need to be able to gather information about all Swift
accounts in the cluster for utilization and auditing purposes. There is
no central list of all accounts in the Swift cluster, so each operator
must implement a method to discover accounts on their own. This patch
aims to build a simple method that all operators can use to get
information about accounts stored in the cluster. The idea is to use a
Watcher hooked into the Account Auditor to collect account data
and Swift Recon to present it.

Change-Id: If1ce42f4e2f30f0b72975790aeeec215f2fe231b
'}]
commit_message:
Get Accounts by Cluster

Cluster operators need to be able to gather information about all Swift
accounts in the cluster for utilization and auditing purposes. There is
no central list of all accounts in the Swift cluster, so each operator
must implement a method to discover accounts on their own. This patch
aims to build a simple method that all operators can use to get
information about accounts stored in the cluster. The idea is to use a
Watcher hooked into the Account Auditor to collect account data
and Swift Recon to present it.

Change-Id: If1ce42f4e2f30f0b72975790aeeec215f2fe231b

commit_message:
Cap installed pip to be < 8

Pip 8 just release which made uninstalling distutils installed packages
fatal. This was previously a deprecation warning and is now causing all
dsvm jobs to fail.

Change-Id: I22f5c3af1adf96cfbd5747122f915a82e947843a
(cherry picked from commit 0ea729ac4908683141e5b1a9ca0d4a0d2390f5ad)

commit_message:
Cap installed pip to be < 8

Pip 8 just release which made uninstalling distutils installed packages
fatal. This was previously a deprecation warning and is now causing all
dsvm jobs to fail.

Change-Id: I22f5c3af1adf96cfbd5747122f915a82e947843a
(cherry picked from commit 0ea729ac4908683141e5b1a9ca0d4a0d2390f5ad)

commit_message:
Fix codes using dict.iteritems() for python3

Stop using dict.iteritems() since it has been removed in python3.
Replace dict(obj.iteritems()) with dict(obj).

Partially implements blueprint: nova-python3-mitaka

The Extend Volume functionality for the VMAX3 is supported in EMC

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-15 11:02:20.000000000', 'files': ['manila/network/standalone_network_plugin.py', 'manila/tests/network/test_standalone_network_plugin.py'], 'message': "Fix usage of standlone_network_plugin

StandaloneNetworkPlugin does not translate 'cidr' attr of
'netaddr.IPNetwork' instance to string explicitly saving data to DB.
It fails because DB cannot write 'netaddr.IPNetwork' instance as
it is not string. So, translate it explicitly.

Change-Id: I2310c15623466bc112c0a46a5122331ef9bc2e6a
Closes-Bug: #1522869
"}]
commit_message:
Fix usage of standlone_network_plugin

StandaloneNetworkPlugin does not translate 'cidr' attr of
'netaddr.IPNetwork' instance to string explicitly saving data to DB.
It fails because DB cannot write 'netaddr.IPNetwork' instance as
it is not string. So, translate it explicitly.

Change-Id: I2310c15623466bc112c0a46a5122331ef9bc2e6a
Closes-Bug: #1522869

commit_message:
Fix db problem for node creation

We need to drop the foreign key reference to cluster from nodes. We are
now defaulting cluster_id to '' instead of None.

Change-Id: I2a1f970f7312eb4e826a9aa666305d66909445db

commit_message:
ITRI DISCO cinder driver

    This commit adds a Cinder volume driver for ITRI DISCO product.
    The DISCO driver supports the following features:
    * Volume Create/Delete
    * Volume Attach/Detach
    * Snapshot Create/Delete
    * Create Volume from Snapshot
    * Get Volume Stats
    * Copy Image to Volume
    * Copy Volume to Image
    * Clone Volume
    * Extend volume

    Implements: blueprint disco-driver-cinder

This patchset also includes the unit tests.

New config options for the cinder driver were also added.
related nova patchset : https://review.openstack.org/253353
related os_brick patchset : https://review.openstack.org/253352

DocImpact
Change-Id: I0168af34364343246a2855bdbd4a9f5ed5b05438

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-18 20:59:28.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Merge pep8 and bandit into linters

Create new linters environment consisting of pep8 and bandit.
Keep pep8 as an alias for linters and add a message when invoked.

Once this change is in, the infra job can be changed to only run

Change-Id: Ib15be94491232d63a345d6fc19869095a2537310

commit_message:
Merge pep8 and bandit into linters

Create new linters environment consisting of pep8 and bandit.
Keep pep8 as an alias for linters and add a message when invoked.

Once this change is in, the infra job can be changed to only run
linters job, this allows to run one less job for each change.

Change-Id: Ib15be94491232d63a345d6fc19869095a2537310

subject: Have zookeeper heartbeat perform basic get
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-15 22:30:05.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/zookeeper.py'], 'message': 'Have zookeeper heartbeat perform basic get

Under situations where greenthreads are used sometimes
the kazoo threads can get starved, which can cause bad
things to happen, so in order to help avoid this have
the zookeeper drivers heartbeat methods fetch the basic
namespace (which will cause heartbeats to also be
flushed and connection verification to happen as a
side-effect).

Related-Bug: #1512001

Change-Id: I244d6c433a41c4b5cd6e0e5d6f01013ccd5db348
'}]
commit_message:
Have zookeeper heartbeat perform basic get

Under situations where greenthreads are used sometimes
the kazoo threads can get starved, which can cause bad
things to happen, so in order to help avoid this have
the zookeeper drivers heartbeat methods fetch the basic
namespace (which will cause heartbeats to also be
flushed and connection verification to happen as a
side-effect).

Related-Bug: #1512001

Change-Id: I244d6c433a41c4b5cd6e0e5d6f01013ccd5db348

subject: Fix invalid date NaN on 2nd graph on details page
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 09:55:19.000000000', 'files': ['app/js/controllers/test.js'], 'message': 'Fix invalid date NaN on 2nd graph on details page

This commit fixes the bug that is when rolling over the 2nd graph with
the mouse, some of the data is not displayed correctly, "NaN/NaN/0NaN"
is displayed instead.

When we use for-in loop against an object, we get a string instead of
integer. So in this patch, I just convert it with parseInt().

Closes-Bug: #1524088
Change-Id: I9d23e5be35c0fd2e0b19fd981db2c9fae476da54
'}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid date NaN on 2nd graph on details page

This commit fixes the bug that is when rolling over the 2nd graph with
the mouse, some of the data is not displayed correctly, "NaN/NaN/0NaN"
is displayed instead.

When we use for-in loop against an object, we get a string instead of
integer. So in this patch, I just convert it with parseInt().

Closes-Bug: #1524088
Change-Id: I9d23e5be35c0fd2e0b19fd981db2c9fae476da54

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-14 11:36:42.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova_plugins/functions-libvirt'], 'message': "libvirt: don't repeatedly configure libvirtd logging

/etc/libvirt is not world-readable (at least on Fedora and RHEL) so
use sudo with the grep that checks whether we have already configured
libvirtd logging. Also, change the regex so we don't count commented
out logging config.

Change-Id: I67484b28aafd0fa828385321fa96d9141cb4cb59
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: don't repeatedly configure libvirtd logging

/etc/libvirt is not world-readable (at least on Fedora and RHEL) so
use sudo with the grep that checks whether we have already configured
libvirtd logging. Also, change the regex so we don't count commented
out logging config.

Change-Id: I67484b28aafd0fa828385321fa96d9141cb4cb59
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Location add catch bad Uri

If a location is added with the Uri 'file://' or something similar it
would cause the sever to raise a internal error. This now catches that
exception, so the server can raise a 400 error.

Closes-Bug: 1502850

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-01-13 14:56:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/quota/driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/quota/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Scope get_tenant_quotas by tenant_id

Using model_query in the operation for retrieving tenant limits
will spare the need for explicit authorization check in the
quota controller. This is particularly relevant for the pecan

commit_message:
Scope get_tenant_quotas by tenant_id

Using model_query in the operation for retrieving tenant limits
will spare the need for explicit authorization check in the
quota controller. This is particularly relevant for the pecan
framework where every Neutron API call undergoes authZ checks
in the same pecan hook.

This patch will automatically adapt by eventuals changes
introducing "un-scoped" contexts.

Closes-bug: #1505406

Change-Id: I6952f5c85cd7fb0263789f768d23de3fe80b8183

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-01-18 23:41:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/db/loadbalancer/test_db_loadbalancerv2.py', 'neutron_lbaas/common/cert_manager/barbican_auth/common.py', 'neutron_lbaas/drivers/vmware/edge_driver_v2.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/common/cert_manager/test_cert_manager.py', 'neutron_lbaas/drivers/radware/v2_driver.py', 'neutron_lbaas/common/cert_manager/__init__.py', 'neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/jinja_cfg.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/common/cert_manager/test_local.py', 'neutron_lbaas/common/cert_manager/barbican_auth/barbican_acl.py', 'neutron_lbaas/common/cert_manager/barbican_auth/__init__.py', 'neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/plugin.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/common/cert_manager/barbican_auth/__init__.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/sample_configs/sample_configs.py', 'neutron_lbaas/common/cert_manager/local_cert_manager.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/common/cert_manager/test_barbican.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/drivers/radware/test_v2_plugin_driver.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/common/cert_manager/barbican_auth/test_barbican_acl.py', 'setup.cfg', 'neutron_lbaas/common/cert_manager/barbican_cert_manager.py', 'neutron_lbaas/common/cert_manager/cert_manager.py'], 'message': 'Refactor BarbicanAuth to allow for configurable auth method

There is now a new configuration option "barbican_auth" in the
certificates section, to specify which auth plugin to use when
communicating with Barbican. This is because the default option (using
ACLs inside Barbican to control access) should be ok as a default
workflow, but it might be required to use other methods depending on
your deployment. For example, another possible auth method would be
BarbicanTrustAuth, utilizing Keystone Trusts.

While we're in this file, prune the unused (and really bad) method that
would *actually* delete certs from Barbican (not in our scope).

This is (nearly) a direct port of the work done in:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216140/

Change-Id: Id8386c36c7acfd954bc2309947345dfe31124b16
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor BarbicanAuth to allow for configurable auth method

There is now a new configuration option "barbican_auth" in the
certificates section, to specify which auth plugin to use when
communicating with Barbican. This is because the default option (using
ACLs inside Barbican to control access) should be ok as a default
workflow, but it might be required to use other methods depending on
your deployment. For example, another possible auth method would be
BarbicanTrustAuth, utilizing Keystone Trusts.

While we're in this file, prune the unused (and really bad) method that
would *actually* delete certs from Barbican (not in our scope).

This is (nearly) a direct port of the work done in:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216140/

Change-Id: Id8386c36c7acfd954bc2309947345dfe31124b16

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 18:00:56.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_setup/detection/plugins/neutron.py'], 'message': 'Remove vendor-specific paths on LBaaS agent executables

The monasca agent uses simple string matching in the process detection
plugin.  This can result in false positive matches in the case where a
process name appears elsehwere in the "ps" output.  In particular,
"neutron-lbaas-agent" is used for both process and log file names.

The initial attempt at solving this used full path names for the LBaaS
agents, but these paths were only valid for specific vendor distributions.
This patch reverts to using only "neutron-lbaasv2-agent" for the V2
LBaaS agent, and uses "bin/neutron-lbaas-agent" for the V1 agent.

While it is possible that a vendor would deliver the neutron-lbaas-agent
in a directory other than "bin", they would be diverging from the
layout generally assumed by the overall neutron project.

Change-Id: I6654d99ea060e26b7cdd5b0bdb1a1c0a2537ba3b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove vendor-specific paths on LBaaS agent executables

The monasca agent uses simple string matching in the process detection
plugin.  This can result in false positive matches in the case where a
process name appears elsehwere in the "ps" output.  In particular,
"neutron-lbaas-agent" is used for both process and log file names.

The initial attempt at solving this used full path names for the LBaaS
agents, but these paths were only valid for specific vendor distributions.
This patch reverts to using only "neutron-lbaasv2-agent" for the V2
LBaaS agent, and uses "bin/neutron-lbaas-agent" for the V1 agent.

While it is possible that a vendor would deliver the neutron-lbaas-agent
in a directory other than "bin", they would be diverging from the
layout generally assumed by the overall neutron project.

Change-Id: I6654d99ea060e26b7cdd5b0bdb1a1c0a2537ba3b

subject: Show last two traceback lines in failure summary stats
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-19 22:45:06.000000000', 'files': ['app/views/directives/tempest-summary.html', 'stackviz/export.py'], 'message': "Show last two traceback lines in failure summary stats

Presently, the failure tracebacks displayed on the tempest summary
directive only show the last line of the failing test's traceback.
After analyzing some sample logs, it was determined that the last
two lines provide a more full picture of the failure, including
exception codes. This patchs adds code to the stackviz-export parser
to include the last two traceback lines for display on the summary
page.

Change-Id: Ib0bffd5b402093adbf1ff6618413df8e8a138670
"}]
commit_message:
Show last two traceback lines in failure summary stats

Presently, the failure tracebacks displayed on the tempest summary
directive only show the last line of the failing test's traceback.
After analyzing some sample logs, it was determined that the last
two lines provide a more full picture of the failure, including
exception codes. This patchs adds code to the stackviz-export parser
to include the last two traceback lines for display on the summary
page.

Change-Id: Ib0bffd5b402093adbf1ff6618413df8e8a138670

revisions:

On tests with pythonlogging, the DEBUG headers can be quite long and
make finding useful information difficult. This patch adds a small,
four-button filter to the test-details page that allows a user to

commit_message:
Add filter functionality to test-details pythonlogging

On tests with pythonlogging, the DEBUG headers can be quite long and
make finding useful information difficult. This patch adds a small,
four-button filter to the test-details page that allows a user to
select which levels of logging to be displayed (INFO, WARNING, ERROR,
DEBUG). This patch will likely serve as the base for additional search
functionality for test details (e.g. queries).

Change-Id: Ia4286861268de0e43313d3b8d7f966e94697a495

commit_message:
Remove lambda usage, fix pep8 E731 violation

Our pep8 is now checking E731 and failing.  This stops passing the  lambda
in questino around and instead just does the work in-line.

Previously pure datetime.datetime.utcnow() was used here, it makes
osprofiler work ok in real OpenStack environment, where
oslo.messaging is used, but in case of out-OpenStack env

Change-Id: I98d9f090e6501c26c9c35b70f65378c58ec2fca8
'}]
commit_message:
Make profiler timestamp json.dumps friendly

Previously pure datetime.datetime.utcnow() was used here, it makes
osprofiler work ok in real OpenStack environment, where
oslo.messaging is used, but in case of out-OpenStack env
it was impossible to simply dump timestamp.

Change-Id: I98d9f090e6501c26c9c35b70f65378c58ec2fca8

subject: Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-17 10:40:09.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper.rb', 'Gemfile'], 'message': 'Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: If15d5f4d60f6badf8659d1ee41d260ec230583a6
'}]
commit_message:
Add rspec-puppet-facts to the spec_helper

This change adds the rspec-puppet-facts gem to the spec helper so that
we can centralize the management of the base operating systems that we
support. rspec-puppet-facts allows us to simplify our unit tests and
provides a more complete list of Operating Systems and their associated
facts for the unit tests.  With this change we can now loop over and
test CentOS, Debian, Fedora, RedHat, and Ubuntu by simply providing a
list of supported os to rspec-puppet-facts.

Additionally this change includes a central object for managing our
supported os list for rspec-puppet-facts and providing our default facts
like os_service_default. This central object should replace the usage of
@default_facts within the unit tests for each module.

Change-Id: If15d5f4d60f6badf8659d1ee41d260ec230583a6

commit_message:
Dynamically generate the plugin registry table

This commit replaces the stale static plugin registry table with one
which is dynamically generated using all the OpenStack git repos. This
will ensure that we have an up to date source of all the plugins being
used by openstack projects.

Change-Id: I72e769e5479f651673ef24b4ee20f92b12049f74

commit_message:
Add finish_volume_migration to volume object

The following patch adds finish_volume_migration() to
the volume object, so it could be used by
migrate_volume_completion() in cinder/volume/manager.py
to properly delete the destination volume on failure.
It also optimizes the call to finish_volume_migration
by using the existing volume objects instead of
performing additional volume lookups.

Change-Id: I02ddf2afb8643e4d3c68934627ad35193e0137ef
Closes-Bug: #1520102
